loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Анаркан есть 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 15 овец. На земельном наделе мерою 0,2 ГА она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Анаркан  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Анаркан будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anarkan successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and all the investors, who helped her with the financing. Currently Anarkan has two cows, two calves and fifteen sheep at her farm. She grows clover for own use on a plot of land of 0.2 hectares.

Anarkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. She will invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep

loans.name: Jose Amado

texts.es:
Jose, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital que le prestó un amigo, este hombre inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido en general de abarrotes como granos, frituras, entre otros.

 Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias,  garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jose has won the affection of all his neighbors for his kindness and good sense of humor. He loves his family, who are his main motivation for striving every day to make a living in order to survive.

Although he did not have the resources to start his business, Jose was not deterred from realizing his dream of becoming a merchant. With a little bit of capital that a friend loaned to him, this man started a grocery store business. He has run this business for one year.

His dreams don't stop there, so he is now requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of general grocery stock like grains, fried foods, and more.

He hopes to be able to improve his economic situation, to have an old-age free of financial concerns, and to guarantee his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries and grains for his business

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Taufik is married and he lives with his family in Cirebon, a port city located on the north coast of West Java island. Cirebon is located about 4 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. 

To support his family's living, Taufik runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumption products, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. 

Taufik was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about three months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Taufik is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Lenlai Group

texts.en:
Ngahnei Kim is a strong and hard-working farmer who sustains her living by selling vegetables she cultivates. Ngahnei Kim is the featured borrower of Lenlai group, pictured with her hand raised. She is blessed with three sons and two daughters. 

Her husband is a peon in government office. His income, however, could not meet the family's expenses with the children's educational cost. “I am very happy with five children who light up my life every day, but when I realize that I cannot provide them with higher education expenses, I feel like an underachiever as a mother," she sighs as she narrates her family story. 

Her eldest daughter had to give up higher education due to the weak finances of the family and help her mother in household chores and cultivation. Since there are no colleges in nearby villages, higher education is costly because she needs to pay either for a rented room or hostel fee and mess fee to join regular classes in town, which is very expensive. The family cannot afford to send her to college with the other four children still in school. 

Ngahnei Kim had availed herself of loans in the previous years which have been utilized in her farming to cultivate seasonal crops. She cultivated corn, ginger, pumpkins and potatoes in the previous years and made profit by selling them in the market. She provides education costs and other household requirements from the profit. 

She is engaged in the field till sunset and comes home with the vegetables she produces from the field. She prepares the vegetables in bundles to sell them early in the next morning. She earns her income from the profit she makes by selling vegetables in the market. 

She holds a good record of repaying the loan amount she had taken in the previous years and aspires to take loans in the future again. The loan she is taking at present will be used for buying saplings for cultivation, and also to buy vegetables from neighbours and villagers for selling in the market to earn more. 

She is very excited and thanks the lenders for their benevolent act and wishes their kindness acts to continue. The other members of the group are all hardworking women engaged in farming, piggeries, vegetable vending and weaving to support their families.

loans.use: To buy saplings for her own cultivation, and also to buy stock of vegetables from other farmers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jofule

texts.en:
Jofule is 32 years old and has two children, both of whom are going to school. He is living in a rural setting. 

As a business, Jofule deals in cattle-keeping as well as cattle-trading. He works seven days per week and 12 hours per day. He started his business to earn a living and get money to support his family members. 

He is acquiring this loan to purchase more cows to fatten and later sell. He said that his clients are traders from his village and those from the nearby villages.

His hope for the future is to enlarge his cattle business and be the leading supplier of cows in his villages. The challenge he faces most is too much drought which ends up leaving grass dry and limits water for his animals. 

Jofule describes himself as an honest and hard-working man who encourages lenders to reduce the interest rates further, so that low income earners can easily access loans. He is grateful for the work done by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is a 50-year-old married man with 10 children, of whom 6 attend school, and he lives in a rural setting with his family. 

He deals in a cattle business and also carries out farming where he grows beans and maize as his side business. He started his business in 1994. He works 7 days a week and 8 hours per day and started his business because most of his family members are in this business, and he expected them to give him some knowledge about the business, and he also wanted to get money to educate his children. 

He acquired this loan to purchase more cows for the business and his clients are cattle traders from different cities.

His future hope is to expand the business and to educate his children. The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital and he describes himself as a hardworking man who appreciates the work that lenders are doing.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to buy materials to paint her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tent, dishes, glasses, forks, spoons, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Editha has been in this business for two years.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkanah is only 24 years old. He lives in Kipsaya village in the mountainous Kapsowar area of Kenya. 

He practices horticultural farming for a living. For the last 2 years, he has made a living selling crops and engaging in seasonal businesses. 

Elkanah is seeking a loan to expand his farm. In order to scale up this business, he needs more land. With the loan, Elkanah will use part of the money to rent land and the rest to pay for farm inputs and labour. This expansion will guarantee a better harvest for the young diligent farmer. 

Income from this investment will offset other farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Elkanah replied, "Even though I am still single, the investment will put food on the table at least daily."

loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que hace 8 años instaló un negocio en su vivienda, en el cual elabora y vende pupusas de chicharrón, queso con loroco, queso con frijoles, revueltas de queso, frijol y chicharrón, dicha actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y aprovechando la afluencia de personas en su vivienda por la venta de pupusas decidió dedicarse también a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, también su compañero de vida da apoyo económico a su hogar gracias a su trabajo en una quesería. Rosa desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old. She lives in a house that she owns with her life partner and their two children. 

She is a resourceful woman who started a business in her home eight years ago making and selling "pupusas" [thick, handmade corn tortillas] with seasoned minced pork, cheese with "loroco" [an edible native flower bud], or stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork. This activity has allowed her to provide for her family. Taking advantage of the flow of people through her house because of her pupusa sales, she decided to also sell beauty products from a catalog. In addition, her life partner contributes economic support to the household thanks to his work in a cheese factory. 

Rosa would like to cement the floor of her house. Because she lacks the necessary financial liquidity, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of her house

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en:
Noriniso is the single mother of four precious children. Through her own initiative she opened a store, beginning with a few products. Her store has now grown. She sells food items such as fruits and vegetables, bread, sugar, candy, tea, etc. 

She lives in north Tajikistan with her family, and is a very enterprising and innovative person, always trying to improve her business. She works every day at her store and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and the excellent service she provides to her customers.

Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become fine professionals. That is why she always strives to provide them with better educations and life standards. 

She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy food items for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing working capital

loans.name: Zyryl

texts.en:
Like most resident of Carles, fishing has been Zyryl's livelihood for a few years now. She works hard to help her husband so she can provide well for her 1-year-old baby boy. 

She is asking for a loan to buy equipment that will help in keeping their business productive and profitable. She will use it to buy a motor engine, fish net, nails, boat propeller, wood, and paints for the boat. With this, she will be assured that her business will go well.

In the future, she plans to engaged in other business endeavors and uplift her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy a motor engine, fish net, nails, boat propeller, wood, and paints for the boat

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Carles, Iloilo. Lea has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 16 years now. Fishing is a lucrative venture in their place. It is the main source of income to the people in her locality.

Lea has decided to borrow a loan to buy a fishing boat, outrigger, paints, and a gas tank. A loan will help her and her husband in improving their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Lea wants to save money to reinvest in her business and to pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, outrigger, paints, and a gas tank

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been engaged in fishing for 25 years now. This business supported her three children when they were little. Her fishing business started a long time ago, but Marilyn wanted to keep it and even plans to expand it. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a new engine and hull for her boat. She is motivated to make her business successful so she can save and provide her family with healthy meals. 

In the future, she plans to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a boat hull and engine

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has four children who are still in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Leslie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu works hard to support her family. She is married and has a automotive repair shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her business.

Marichu has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, fish, spices, noodles, etc., for her food vending business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, fish, spices, noodles, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 52 years old and married with three children.

Virgilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Virgilia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Virgilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Meet Ade. Ade is a teacher and he lives with his wife and their only child in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. 

To support his family living, Ade runs a small stall that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, mobile phone airtime, daily consumption products, and women’s accessories for his customers. 

Ade was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Ade is in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy (Pictured 4th in the middle of 6 children) is the main care provider and financial supporter for her children (pictured left to right: Isaiah, Odin, Hannah, Erik, Andy and Tonya) ages 5 to 16. Amy previously worked fulltime; however, her company lost funding leaving Amy as a temporary employee. At the end of a 3 month period, Amy found herself without a job and 6 children to support. Amy found work as a Security Officer, but has only been able to work part time despite her requests for additional hours. The father of Amy’s children, Carl (man pictured left wearing a blue shirt) also works in an effort to help Amy provide for their children; however, he works for very low wages leaving Amy to cover most of their living expenses.  Amy’s house is in dire need of repairs. A new air conditioner, being one of them, will replace the unit that is currently not in working order, and contains heavy mold that is affecting the health of Amy’s children. Amy also needs to replace an inoperable sliding glass door that has not opened and closed properly for some time now. This door, not only poses a hazard as it must always be left partially open to allow access to the outside, but is causing high electric bills for this large family. 

Amy will use her KIVA loan to install a new air conditioner which will improve the comfort of her home, as well as alleviate the multiple health issues her children have experienced with the old unit. Amy will also have a new sliding glass door installed so that her family can freely access their backyard while also being able to securely close and lock the door to provide safety and security for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a new air conditioner and sliding glass door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles,rafters, and wood to improve the ceiling of her home

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
It's not an easy life for Teresa to be in a fishing business for 21 years now. It is all hard work and perseverance. She works hard in her fishing business in order to support her five children aged 7-20. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a compressor, engine, paint, adhesive, bamboo, boat propeller, hard wood, and nylon to maintain her fishing business and increase productivity. The income that she will generate will keep her children in school and her family healthy. In the future, she aims to expand her fishing business and send her children to school for their better future.

Teresa is 40 years old from Carles, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, engine, paint, adhesive, bamboo, boat propeller, hard wood, and nylon

loans.name: Aliaa'

texts.en:
Aliaa' is 27 years old, married and has four children. She has a secondary education. She works with her husband at a coffee shop. Her family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was destroyed. 

She applied for a loan request to build the walls of her house before the winter season. She plans to purchase cement and stones with the money received and to install electricity. She hopes to be able to provide her sons with the best life conditions; she is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to purchase cement and to install electricity

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a direct-selling business for Avon products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a chainsaw operator service. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lipstick, body spray, perfume, deodorant, etc., to sell for her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like lipstick, body spray, perfume, deodorant, etc., to sell

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 28 years old and he lives with his parents in the village of Vazashen in Tavush region. Roman has a brother who is now in the Russian Federation for work abroad. He is thankful for his first Kiva loan, which also helped him to develop his farming and enlarged his family income. 

Roman and his parents are perfect farmers. Thanks to his laborious character, Roman also is a skilled farmer, and the largest part of the work about the farm now is his duty. On his farm he has six cows, two calves, a bull, a sheep, two pigs, twenty chickens, and three beehives. 

Roman’s mother helps her son with the sale of farm products such as milk, meat, eggs, and honey. Roman also has a plot of land, which gives him a sweet and tasty harvest of persimmons, figs, nuts, and cornel (local fruit used for jam). These entire sales make this young man’s family’s income. 

So, Roman needs this loan for providing fodder for his farm cattle; he will buy a lot of hay and also barley for the farm cattle for the cold winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of hay and also barley for the farm cattle for the cold winter months.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three pigs (two sows and one boar) and cement as part of SSLLP's commercial piggery program.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, and paint needed in making wood carvings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the costs of the University certificate for his nephew

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora, 35, is an ambitious, hardworking, smallholder mixed-farmer based in North Tajikistan. The climate here greatly favours high-altitude cash crops and dairy farming, which she is involved in. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to sustain her family of four children; all of them are non-adults. 

She has been busy with this business more than ten years. She works hard every day to earn a living and offer better living conditions for her children. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers for her land for the new autumn sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for her land.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old and married with four children who are in school. Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jenny has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 64 years old and married with three children.

Virgilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like seasonings, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell.

Virgilia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Virgilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like seasonings, cereals, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized sheets, and wood to repair the roof of her house and to cement the walls of one room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and pay for employees to make home improvements

loans.name: Fula

texts.en:
Fula is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She has a secondary education. She works at a beauty salon for ladies. Her family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was destroyed. 

She applied for a loan request to build the walls of her house before the winter season. She plans to rebuild the bathroom and the kitchen and paint the house again. She hopes to be able provide her sons the best living conditions. 

She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to build the walls of her house before the winter season

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 59 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Virgincita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgincita has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 years old and married with three children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supply of products for the home and thus, to supply her small store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Maria has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 56 years old and has eight children. Agustina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Agustina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Agustina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Agustina has been raising pigs for six years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Agustina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is married and lives with his wife and their only child in North Tangerang, a city located south of Jakarta. To support his family, Muhammad runs a small store that sells snacks, drinks, daily consumption products, mobile phone SIM cards, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. 

Muhammad was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Muhammad is in his small store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Nurdin

texts.en:
Nurdin is married and lives with his wife and their only child in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Nurdin sells mobile phone airtime to his customers.

Nurdin was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about five months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is excited about his new business which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. Nurdin thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Maria Elizabet

texts.es: María es una señora esforzada de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 24 años de laborar, ya que imparte sus clases en el área rural, donde se tiene que transportar para llegar a su centro de trabajo, de mañana, soltera sin hijo a su cargo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de resolver un problema  familiar, por eso visito Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en compra de cemento arena y gavineta para su  cocina, con los cuales repellaria su cocina los que le vendría a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is an energetic woman who has been working as a primary school teacher for 24 years. She teaches in a rural area and must travel in order to get to work.

María is single and has no children under her care. At the moment, she needs to resolve a family problem, so she visited the office of CEPRODEL in order to request a loan to buy cement, sand, a cupboard, and to pay for employees whose will fix her current kitchen. This will help to improve her conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for employees whose will fix  her current kitchen.

loans.name: Juan Noel

texts.es: Juan es un señor activista, de profesión Bachiller y maestro de educación primaria con 5 años de laborar, soltero sin hijos a su cargo, esta ubicado en un colegio fuera de la localidad donde vive, este señor nos comunico sobre el problema que le acoge actualmente de índole familiar, por tal razón visito Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en pago de tramites de legalizacion de terreno y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is an activist, and he has his high school diploma.  He profession is teaching primary school, and he has been doing this for five years.  He is single and does not have children under his care.  He works at a school that is outside of the area where he lives.

This man told us about a personal family problem that he currently has.  It is for this reason that he visited CEPRODEL to request a loan.  He will use the loan to pay the expenses of land legitimization in this way he will improve his living conditions and his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the costs of land legitimization

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of jewelry to sell for her business.

Avelina has been in this business for four years. Avelina earns more income from her general store.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lorna has a sewing business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional garments and other materials needed for her business.

Lorna has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional garments and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Charitte

texts.en:
Charitte is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like curtains, decorations, etc. to sell for her business.

Charitte has been in this business for three years. Charitte earns more income from her general store.

Charitte has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like curtains, decorations, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucia is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy products and ingredients for her  business.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 42 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarette, shampoo, etc..

Emily has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to increase her head count of livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary things for a dowry.

loans.name: Shawq

texts.en:
Shawq is 23 years old, married and has two children. She works at the family farm for the birds. Her family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and her house was partly destroyed. 

She applied for a loan to build the ceiling of her house before the winter season. She also plans to paint the house again from the money that she will receive. 

She hopes to be able provide her sons with the best living conditions; she is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to build the ceiling of her house before the winter season

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase clothing, footwear, undergarments to sell. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would like to apply again for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more personal and household products such a bags, undergarments, footwear and cleaning agents. People prefer to buy such goods from dealers for convenience and for their quality. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Margie dreams of having another outlet to sell her personal products. She wants to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more merchandise items and products to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cirila is 48 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

Cirila has a lumber-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of lumber to sell.

Cirila has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
	
For the past six months, Maureen has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000, Maureen wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Alicia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: José Edicto

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, poco le gusto la escuela por lo que no le ponía mucho empeño, lo que le gustaba era el trabajo en el campo junto a su papá.  Está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, solo tienen un hijo el que vive con ellos, aun no va a la escuela. Por hoy solo los tres viven en su hogar.

José se dedica a la venta de leña (carbón), la cual compra la prepara y la vende en la ciudad, ya tiene más de 5 años de realizar el negocio, la forma de aprender el trabajo fue  por medio de su padre, también fue de su padre que aprendió que la vida solo es más llevadera cuando se trabaja honradamente y es aplicado de su trabajo. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra frijol, maíz y maicillo, también negocia con motores, al encontrar uno a bajo precio lo compra para luego venderlo en un mejor precio, por lo demás no ha tenido otro negocio antes.

 La distancia que recorre es 1km diario, el recorrido lo hace a pie, también paga quien le ayude a realizar la actividad, el horario de trabajo es de las 6:00 am a 12:00 md.  Al cliente un crédito anterior se le tramito por kiva y logro realizar unos arreglos en su casa, como por ejemplo mejorar las puertas de la casa.  

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una motocicleta que se la venden a bajo precio, por lo que quiere aprovechar de comprarla para poder venderla mejor después de algunos ajustes que le realice. 

Los sueños que tiene a futuro son el poder mejorar su casa de habitación y que su hijo crezca en mejores condicione a las que él se creció.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and studied through sixth grade. He didn’t like school, which is why he didn’t put very much determination into it. What he liked was working on the farm with his father. He is married, and his wife is dedicated to household tasks. They only have one child, who lives with them; he doesn’t attend school yet. As of today, only the three of them live in their house.

José sells firewood (coal), which he buys, prepares, and then sells in the city. He has already done this work for 5 years. He learned this work from his father; it was also from his father that he learned that life is easier when one works honorably and is dedicated to his work. Additionally, he works in agriculture. He grows beans, corn, and sorghum. He also does business in cars; upon finding one at a low price, he buys it and then re-sells it at a better price. Otherwise, he has not had other businesses so far.

He covers 1 kilometer daily on foot. He also pays someone that helps him with his work. His work schedule is from 6:00am to noon. He received a previous loan from Kiva and succeeded in making repairs to his home, such as improving the doors of his house.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a motorcycle that is sold at a low price, because he wants to take advantage of buying it so that he can sell it at a better price after he makes some adjustments.

His dreams for the future are to be able to improve his house and for his son to grow up in better conditions than he did.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that is sold at a low price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay employees in order to correct cracks in a room

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is 37 years old, and lives with her husband and four sons in Gaza. She has raised poultry  for three years. 

Her house was destroyed from the last war in Gaza and she would like to repair it but she lost all her property.  She wants  to take the first step and return to a normal life. 

She has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials, also pay for rebuilding. 

Rana is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to return to a normal life  with her family, and to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials, and pay for the worker to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is a 30-year-old married woman with  four children, three children attend school.

Elaine has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

She has previously borrowed 5 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elaine would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 40 years old. She is married and has five children. 

Kousar has a small business of animal-selling. She has been doing this business for the last ten years. She purchases animals at a lower price and then sells them at a higher price. 

She wanted to increase her business income, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. 

With this loan, Kousar will definitely expand her business and income level. It is her eighth loan cycle and she has shown a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to sell.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Idris joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Awwal, Babangida and Nasuru. Idris is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for supplies, Idris expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Idris to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Idris said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to pay for urgent expenses, school fees, food, and  farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wardrobe

loans.name: Laura Patricia

texts.es: Laura de 26 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos desde hace 6 años. Ella es una mujer que siempre sale adelante porque su esfuerzo y sus ganas de luchar son mayores a las adversidades de su vida, es por ello que al encontrarse sin empleo hace 3 años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de queso, actividad que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. Laura desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que ha decidido repellar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que estas son de adobe y tiene el temor que se vuelvan un foco de anidación de plagas, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y mano de obra para repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Laura is 26 years old and has lived in her own house with her life partner and two children for the past 6 years. She is a woman who always gets ahead because her efforts and her desire to fight are greater than the adversity in her life. So when she found herself without work 3 years ago she decided to work making and selling cheese an activity that allows her to sustain her household.

Laura wants to improve the living conditions of her family. So she has decided to plaster the walls of her house which is made out of adobe. She has the fear that they will become a breeding ground for infestations. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and labor to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and to pay for labor to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and ceramic

loans.name: Al Boushra Group

texts.en:
Marleine is the featured borrower of Al Boushra group, she joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard to develop their families' standard of  living and businesses.

Marleine is a 40-year-old married mother of three, who has been  baking Saj bread for two years to support her husband.  Her husband is a driver and they try to cover their family's increasing living needs and requests.

Marleine runs her business from her house since she can't afford to open a separate bakery. Her loan will be invested in buying a new released Saj bread oven (Concave shaped Oven), that will help her to improve her production and increase her business income.

She hopes to open a separate bakery and recruit others to help her  increase her production.

Marleine is the first lady from the left, Rana is the lady at the center, and  Nidal is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy a new released Saj bread oven that will help her improve her production and increase her business income.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 34-year-old who lives in Gaza with his wife and their seven children. His wife is unemployed and the kids are completing their middle school studies. His house was damaged by the last war in Gaza.

The goal of the loan will be to buy construction tools, since these are important for him to mend the damages, and to be able pay for the workers. He wants to rebuild the damaged walls and install electricity, doors, and windows.

One of his biggest dreams is to see his children grow and to give them an education so that they can become professionals. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to buy construction tools, and to be able pay for the workers; he wants to rebuild the damaged walls, install electricity, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Celrose

texts.en:
Celrose is 40 years old and married with four children in school. Celrose works very hard to provide for them.

Celrose has run a general store for 3 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  shampoo, canned goods, and cigarettes.

She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Celrose would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, canned goods, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 54-year-old married woman with two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eleuteria has operated a food vending business for 10 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and items for her business.

 In the future, Eleuteria would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and items for her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: This is Caroline, 37 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She operates a grocery shop that sells spinach, kale, tomatoes and cabbages. She is applying for a loan to add more stock in her shop. She hopes this will enable her to supply more and then increase her income. This will enable her to pay for her children's education. Caroline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cabbages, kales, tomatoes, and spinach.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sagiru, Sahaibu, and Idi. Bala is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Bala expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Bala to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Bala said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, and food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors, fences and pay employees for works in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition and buy materials.

loans.name: Noujoud

texts.en:
Noujoud is a 39-year-old, divorced woman, who started two years ago, tailoring and selling clothes to cover her needs and expenses because she didn't have any source of income.

Today, Noujoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with a new, fashionable, winter clothes collection to satisfy her customers needs and, thus, increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

Noujoud hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new, fashionable, winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is a married woman with eight children who works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business, earns additional income from a general store, and sells frozen foods.  Flordelyn requests 13,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy more meat to sell for her meat vending business.

Flordelyn has sustained her business  through her 5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall.

loans.name: Mohammad Boota

texts.en:
Muhammad Boota is a 36-year-old married man with 6 children. A year ago, he started a school. Despite operating for a short time, 126 students from Nursery to Grade 10 study in the school. Muhammad  employs 10 teachers,  8 are women.   Muhammad Boota is motivated  to improve his school and make it the best of his community.  He wants to increase his business capital to provide for his family and reinvest in the school. 

He needs 100,000 PKR to buy chairs and desks for his students,  improve the school environment by painting the walls, and completing necessary repair work.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for his students, and to improve the school environment by painting the walls and completing repair work that is required.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Fatkiyatul

texts.en: Fatkiyatul is a housewife who lives with her husband, their only child, and one other family member in Solo, one of major cities in Java Island, Indonesia. To support her family, she runs a stall where she sells snacks, drinks, other food items, and mobile phone airtime. Fatkiyatul was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends and became interested in joining about two months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She is excited about selling mobile phone airtime because this is a new business for her. She is requesting a loan from Kiva because this will help her provide greater access to mobile services to people her community. In the photo, we see Fatkiyatul in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to sell mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  engine replacement parts for her car.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 26 years old, and lives with his family in Gaza. He has been working at his mini market.  His family was affected by the last war at Gaza, and his  house was  totally destroyed.   He applied for  a loan to start to rebuild his house.   He plans to buy building materials and pay for the worker to start the rebuilding. He hopes to be able provide his family the best life conditions.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild his house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elena has a pig raising business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 52-year-old married woman with four children. She trys hard to fulfill their demands by providing good food, healthy conditions, clothing, and education.  

She with her husband have grown fruit and vegetables  for many years. They sell them in the local market.  Her son also  grows and waters  the various crops to produce good quality producce. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seed and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shameem requests 50,000 PKR to help her to grow more crops which will generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seed and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Aziz  Fatima

texts.en:
Aziz Fatima is a 54-year-old married woman with 5 children. For the past 10 years, she and her husband  have  sold cattle. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them.   Her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including purchasing food and clothing.  

In order to expand their earnings, Aziz Fatima has requested 45,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes.  This will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Isty, Maryam and Magret. Iliya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Iliya expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Iliya to generate earnings of up to USD 1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Iliya said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children and, ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food, and  farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet seat, sink and pay the employees to install these pieces

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 54-year-old man married man.  His wife's name is Alice. They have 4 children and both work to earn income to support their family.  Peter has operated a cereal shop for ten years to earn 10,000 at the end of every month.

Peter requests 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya to buy additional maize and beans to sell to his customers.

Peter plans to use the anticipated income to pay his children's school fees  and hopes to expand his business and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional maize and beans.

loans.name: Licet Tatiana

texts.es:
Licet es una madre de 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, es muy responsable y amorosa tanto en su hogar como en su trabajo y es que se dedica a realizar peinados a domicilio,
Licet buscando estar cerca de sus hijos quiere iniciar  su negocio en un local comercial pero dará pequeños pasos y quiere apoyarse tanto en la corporación interactuar como en los “prestamistas” de buen corazón de Kiva para comprar una silla para motilar y algunos insumos de peluquería para iniciar su negocio en su casa y poder estar cerca de sus dos hijos que necesitan tanto de su madre.
Este crédito le permitirá seguir trabajando por el futuro de su hogar y ejercer su profesión de madre.
texts.en: Licet is a mother of two children ages 2 and 4.  She is very responsible and loving both at home and at work.  She works out of her home as a hairdresser.  Wanting to be closing to her children, Licet wants to start a business in a retail space, so she is taking small steps to be able to support herself as well as her business. She is seeking a loan from the good-hearted Kiva lenders to purchase a hairdresser chair as well as some hairdressing supplies to start her business in her home so that she can be near her two children who need her.  This credit will allow her to continue working towards the future of her household and be a mother to her children.

loans.use: purchase a hairdressing chair and supplies to provide beauty services from her home.

loans.name: Rukhasana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 43-year-old married woman. She has successfully run a small general store with her husband in a corner of their house. She has three years' experience in this field, and her husband helps by buying stocks of goods from the market, where he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business but has not had enough funds to do this. So she has requested a loan for PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, oil, biscuits and beverages to sell and to meet increasing demand. She expects to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 31-year-old, hardworking woman who has three children. For the last 8 years, she has sewn clothes in her locality. She is quite popular due to her skills. Sakina’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. 

Over the years, she has established a good clientele. In her 4th loan cycle, she has requested 40,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine, thread,  and laces to meet customers’ orders on time to generate an healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and laces to meet with customers’ orders on time.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 35 years old and married. She has three children. She works hard to meet their demands and provides food, clothing, and healthy conditions. 

Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her tailoring business  to contribute to the family's income. She is familiar with tstitching techniques and has a good customer base. 

She requested 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, cloth, needles, and buttons to create more dresses on time to generate income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cloth, needles, and buttons to create dresses on time to generate more income for the family.

loans.name: Fernaz

texts.en: Fernaz, aged 28 years, is a very enthusiastic person. She wanted to provide her family with better living conditions. Therefore she has been successfully running a shop-keeping business for five years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Fernaz needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Fernaz has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Muazu

texts.en:
Muazu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Muazu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Tina, Naomi and Alhamdu. 

Muazu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Muazu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muazu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muazu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Muazu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Muazu said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, buy food and make farm loan repayments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc for the ceiling of the home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment for his uncle (dialysis)

loans.name: Faroq

texts.en:
Faroq is 42 years old,and lives with his wife,and son in Gaza. He has been employed at a government institution for eighteen years. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza and his house was partially destroyed. He would like to repair his home and requests a loan from Ryada to install pipelines and rebuild the walls damaged by shooting. 

Faroq is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to return to his normal life with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children

loans.use: to install pipelines and rebuild the walls damaged by gun fire.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 43 years old and four of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
En el municipio de Sonson, habitan muchas mujeres emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro; una de ellas es Luz, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como un hobbie pero que poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de su pequeña hija de 9 años.

Ella, siendo una madre muy joven, no tiene mucha experiencia, pero tiene un gran corazón y energía para su hija.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una algodón, silicona y en general insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Con estos elementos podrá aumentar y mejorar el proceso de fabricación de sus obras, que son vendidas principalmente en almacenes, ferias, y algunos habitantes del municipio.
texts.en:
In the town of Sonson live many entrepreneurial and hard-working women with the desire and strength to move forward and fight for a good future. One of them is Luz, a woman who with her charisma and great ability to work has been able to overcome various obstacles that have arisen in her life.

She has a very small business making and selling crafts in her own house. She started this craft as a hobby, but little by little it became a real source of income for supporting her small daughter, who is 9 years old. Luz, being a very young mother, does not have much experience, but she has a big heart and energy for her daughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy silicone, cotton, and other materials to make her crafts. With these items, she will be able to expand and improve the production process of her crafts, which are sold primarily in stores and fairs and to some of the members of the town.

loans.use: to buy silicone, cotton, and other materials to make her crafts.

loans.name: Jair Eduardo

texts.es:
Jair es un hombre humilde y trabajador que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Rionegro desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Jair y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Jair desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de sillas y remodelación de su cocina.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Jair is a humble and hardworking man who has dedicated a large portion of his life to taking care of his children.  He lives in a municipality of Rionegro where he works incredibly hard in the kitchen since he has a business catering food such as tamales, chorizos, empanadas, etc.  He primarily sells these foods to neighbors in the area who know Jair's flavor and know that they will always get delicious and well-prepared foods.

Jair wants to increase his food sales and work more comfortably.  For this reason, he is seeking a loan to purchase chairs and remodel his kitchen.  This loan will allow him to get ahead with his business so that he can generate the necessary earnings to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: purchase chairs and remodel his kitchen.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.en:
Jackeline is 23 years old and married with two children.

Jackeline is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Jackeline has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jackeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 40 years old and has eight children who are currently in school.

Alma has a buy and sell of firewood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

Alma has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Violet dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000, she wants to purchase stock of rice, maize, beans and wheat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, maize, beans and wheat.

loans.name: Riaz  Begum

texts.en: Riaz Begum, age 50, is a married woman. She sells animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough money from her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra income. Riaz Begum needs to improve her business to manage her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and increase her income level. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. Some years ago, she and her husband started a small general store. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers. 

They have become popular in their community for providing good quality products.  They earn enough money to meet the expenses of their children. Zahida requests 60,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing customer demand. 

She is expecting an increase in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen has successfully established a business to weave sweaters and caps with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. She has a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute in the family's  income. 

She used a previous loan  to expand her business. She is in her 4th loan cycle and requests 45,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, wool, and packs of needles. 

This will enable her to meet  customers’ demands on time and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase  spools of thread, wool, and  packs of needles..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for legalization expenses for the construction of the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and have medical tests

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en: Amjad is 22 years old and lives with his family in Gaza. His living conditions prevented him from getting a higher education, so he works at a poultry farm. He is one of the people affected by the last war in Gaza because his house was partly destroyed. He would like to repair it and is committed to take the first step so he can get back to his normal life. That is why he has requested a loan from Ryada to build ceiling and walls as a start, then install pipes and buy more building materials to continue renovating his home. Amjad is very grateful to everyone who has helped him. He hopes to be able to get back to his normal life, and provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and improve his home.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 55 years old and married with five children.  Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario has run a general store for 20 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, canned goods, and cigarettes.

She has previously borrowed 11 times t from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money to secure her family's  future.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, cigarettes, and canned goods.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur and runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. Juliet has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food to sell. She has been in this business for two years and would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mutirithia Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand on the photograph is Esther, a member of Mutirithia Women Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in  2013 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training. 

Esther is  46 years old, married,  and lives with her three children. She operates a cafe to sell porridge, tea,  and doughnuts.  She is borrowing  to buy  flour, sugar and milk. She hopes this will enable her to meet customers' rising demand.  

She looks forward to improving her income  and be in a position to provide food for the family.

Esther and members of  this group are very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She and her husband (also shown in the photo) provide flour grinding services. She knows the techniques of grinding very well and has ten years of experience in this field. They have become well known for providing fine quality flour and earn enough to support the needs of the family members. In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Shamim contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. It will help her to cater to more customers consistently, which ultimately helps to generate more cash. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new flour grinding machine

loans.name: Magalis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Magalis inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios hace años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, busco esta actividad como un alternativa de generar dinero ya que su situación sentimental es actualmente divorcia y como mujer pujante, verraca pero ante todo delicada y bella busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus dos hijos de 12 y 5 años, debido al alza de los precios de la canasta familiar, del arriendo, gastos escolares, Magalis se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos y es por este motivo que necesita un crédito que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta, solicita un crédito para la compra de billeteras y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de servicios.
 
Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y sabe que esta pro buen camino.
texts.en:
Moguls started her retail business, specifically selling accessories, many years ago.  She learned this trade thanks to a friend.  She sought this work as an alternative for earning an income because she is currently divorced, and as a strong, yet delicate and beautiful, woman she desperately sought a way to provide for her family, which is made up of her two children aged 12 and 5.  Given the high prices of the family's food needs, rent and school, Magalis is in need of earning a greater income, which is why she is seeking a loan.

This loan will help her to improve the variety of products that she has in stock and sells to her customers.  She is seeking a loan to purchase wallets and lotions to add to her inventory.  Her main dream is to become the owner of a store and she knows that she is on the right path for that.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of items for her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a business of cattle purchase and sale, with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo), for the past 10 years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.
