She is in her sixth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling that will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramics to put on her house porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a pacemaker for her son

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Her son (also shown in the photo) started driving a truck some time ago that carries various materials from one place to another. He earns a good income to support his family financially. To help her son improve his business, Perveen has applied for a loan for 45,000 PKR. Her son will use this money to pay for the repair and maintenance costs of his vehicle. She is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of their vehicle.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORCONA” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas y a prestar servicios. Delia tiene 40 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y gaseosas en forma ambulatoria en el peaje de la zona en el cual radica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de panes para expenderlos y de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos encomios y más frutas y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Delia es la segundado del lado derecho viste chaleco marrón.
texts.en:
The group "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DE CORCONA" [New Hope of Corcona] is a group made up of members who work in retail sales and provide services.

Delia is 40 years old and is in a domestic partnership with two dependent children. She sells fruits and soft drinks as a street vendor at the tollbooth near where she lives. She will use the loan towards buying bread for resale as well as more fruit and soft drinks and in this way increase her profits.

The group thanks KIVA for the loan offered.

Delia is the second on the right, dressed in a brown vest.

loans.use: to buy bread, more fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra has successfully established a canteen with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more stock of snacks, juices, sweets and some stationery items to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of snacks, juices, sweets and some stationery items to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Theoplus, Kauna and Sunday. Dauda is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Dauda expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to receive cash for immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Dauda to generate earnings of up to 1,000 USD/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Dauda said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal for his blacksmith's shop

loans.name: Jhonalie

texts.en:
Jhonalie is 33 years old and single.

Jhonalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, canned goods, milk, juice, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Jhonalie has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jhonalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, canned goods, milk, juice, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: At the age of 50, Rani is a married woman and the mother of 4 children. One of her sons is shown in the photo: he is running a photography business. He makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. He is quite popular in his locality and has retained customers.  She has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for the improvement of her son’s business. It will allow him to purchase another camera to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase another camera to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Nhyira Nsa Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of Nhyira Nsa Group. She turns 62 this year and she is a widow with 2 children. Sarah's children are still in school. She lives with her family at Abakrampa which is in the central region of Ghana. 

Sarah grow oranges on 5 acres. Sarah has a future plan of increasing the size of her farm. She also belongs to a registered local farming association that negotiates prices on their behalf. Sarah has confidence in the future prospects of her business since her farming association has a lot of good will from development partners in building their capacity to maintain farm hygiene to increase crop yield.

Sarah does not have the physical strength now to maintain the farm alone, as age is not on her side. Her main challenge is how to finance the costs of maintaining her farm to maximize productivity. In particular, Sarah has to hire laborers to harvest and transport the crops to a point of sale. A micro-loan is essential for Sarah to maximize profit. She will also use her profit to  pay for her children's school fees. 

Sarah and her group members are grateful to all their micro-lenders for their generosity in supporting their business.

loans.use: to hire laborers to harvest and transport the crops to a point of sale.

loans.name: Mado 1 Group

texts.en:
Nayefa is the featured borrower for Mado 1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nayefa is a 48-year-old married mother of two children. Due to her husband's limited income and the increase in living costs, she decided to start selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Thus she is now acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with fashionable clothes that will attract customers and satisfy their needs.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is a 46-year-old married mother of four children who sells clothes from her house and wants to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable clothes, while Zeinab is a 19-year-old single lady who works as a hairdresser and wants to buy necessary beauty tools.

Nayefa is the lady sitting in the middle, Fatima is the first lady on the right, and Zeinab is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with fashionable clothes

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This is Hanaa’s second loan cycle from Ryada. Her previous loan helped her to develop her business and had a positive outcome. She was able to increase her stock, and she is very grateful to everyone who helped her.

Today, Hanaa is applying for this loan to repair her house after the Gaza war. Her house was fully destroyed, and for these reasons, she has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement and other building materials and also pay for the worker to start working at rebuilding. Hanaa is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to be back to her normal life again with her family at their house and to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Karen requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

In the future, Karen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Laura works hard to support her family.

She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Laura is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of computer and pay for electric and internet bills for her internet cafe business.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of computer and pay for electric and internet bills

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jolita has been in pig fattening for 40 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Juanita has been in this business for 14 years. Juanita earns more income from a general store.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Krobor Bukum Group

texts.en:
These two members led by Patience as the representative, are part of the group called Krobor Bukum. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling plastic products, cooking utensils and firewood. They will need a total amount of GHS 2,800 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Patience is a member. Patience says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her eighth loan request with ID-Ghana. She currently has a business selling plastic chairs, plastic tables, and cooking utensils. Patience will use her part of this loan, GHS 2,200, to increase her capital. She will buy plastic chairs, plastic tables and cooking utensils and sell to customers. She will sell them by distributing them to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family.

Patience is 38 years old, single and has two dependent children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Patience replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

Maud sells firewood. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, plastic tables and cooking utensils and sell to customers.

loans.name: Pedro Del Carmen

texts.es: Pedro nació en el año 1976 en un lugar llamado Datanlí ubicado a 15km de la ciudad de Jinotega. Pedro asistía a la escuela de la comunidad, sin embargo su asistencia era muy irregular debido a que en esa época se vivía la guerra en Nicaragua y era muy peligroso. Cuando Pedro finalizó la eduación primaria se dedicó a trabajar en haciendas donde hacía la labor de mandador. Pedro actualmente está casado y tiene dos hijos, uno de 11 años y una hija de 7 años, para Pedro sus dos hijos son su mayor orgullo y el los apoya para que ellos puedan tener una educación de calidad. Actualmente Pedro siembra café y otros granos básicos lo cual representa su mayor fuente de ingresos. En la comunidad donde Pedro y su familia habitan no existe la energía eléctrica, es por eso que ellos necesitan comprar un pequeño sistema solar para poder realizar sus labores diarias con mas eficiencia, mejorando así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro was born in 1976 in a place called Datanlí, located 15km from the city of Jinotega. He attended the school in his community, however his attendance was very irregular since during this time Nicaragua was at war and it was very dangerous. When Pedro finished primary school, he started working on plantations where he worked as a foreman.

Now, Pedro is married and has two children, an 11 year old son and a 7 year old daughter. For him, his two children are his biggest pride, and he supports them so that they can have a quality education. 

Pedro plants coffee and other basic grains, which provides his largest source of income. In the community where he and his family live there is no electric power, and for this they need to buy a small solar panel system to be able to more efficiently perform their daily tasks, improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Bara'a Group

texts.en:
This group is called Bara'a. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Amat is the leader of the group. She is a 45-year-old widowed woman, living in miserable conditions. She studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because she got married when she was very young. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. He passed away several years ago. 

Amat's father is an employee with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover the necessary needs of his house. Notwithstanding, he gives a part of his salary to his daughter Amat because her husband passed away and she doesn't have any source of income. The house where Amat lives lacks new furniture. Amat strives strongly to improve the living standards of her family. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Amat applied for a loan of 30,000 YER to purchase new bed for the house.

Amat looks forward to providing her house with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new bed for the house.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Madelyn is 33 years old and has eight children who are in school.

Madelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Madelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Madelyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make quick repairs and renovations to his old house.

loans.name: Zubairu Sabo

texts.en:
Zubairu Sabo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Zubairu Sabo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Arma and Mamman. Zubairu Sabo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for farm supplies, Zubairu Sabo expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, which is double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zubairu Sabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zubairu Sabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Zubairu Sabo to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Zubairu Sabo said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with nine children.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leila Maria

texts.es:
Leila es una mujer que a traviesa una difícil situación y es que la pérdida de su marido quien falleció le ha dado un bajón anímico y depresión que solo lo entienden quienes han perdido un ser querido.
Es madre de 2 hijos jóvenes y gracias a su negocio de papelería ha logrado generar recursos para que puedan vivir dignamente  pero su momento no es el ideal y ha consultado y la mejor manera d levantar su negocio es invirtiendo en este y por ello llega a la corporación a solicitar un crédito para comprar variedad de mercancía y darle un nuevo respiro  a su negocio que es la única fuente de dinero que tiene desde el fallecimiento de su esposo.
texts.en: Leila is a woman who comes through a difficult situation. The death of her spouse gave her a feeling of despair and depression that only those who have lost a loved one would understand. She is the mother of 2 children and thanks to her paper supply business she has been able to generate income to be able to live with dignity but her situation is not ideal. She has decided that the best way to grow her business is to invest in it and therefore she seeks a loan to buy a variety of merchandise to breath new life into her business that is her only source of income with the passing of her husband.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items to stock her paper supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: El Pirai Group

texts.es:
Mariela es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, madre de tres niños de 1, 2 y 18 años y su negocio es una tienda de barrio.
Mariela es emprendedora, buena madre, trabajadora, constante, y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en su domicilio que está ubicado en las cabañas del río Piraí, zona sur de su ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse enclavadas en las márgenes del majestuoso curso de agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas.
Mariela es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y habla guaraní por herencia familiar (de pie a la derecha, con polera celeste).  Su vida la comparte con su tres hijos, el mayor se encuentra terminando la escuela secundaria y los menores están al cuidado de la madre. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores utilidades y satisfacer a su familia, la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo, esta es su segunda secuencia en los cuatro años que viene desarrollando esta labor. Su actividad principal es una tienda de barrio con alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, refrescos, etc. Los fines de semana se dedica a la cocina realizando pequeños platillos para aquellos que pasean por el río, como; el ‘majao’ que es arroz con queso plátano frito y huevo frito, ‘masaco’ que es a base de carne con yuca y queso, ‘el sonso’ que se trata de una mezcla de yuca y queso, etc. Debido al cuidado de su hijos menores se le hace muy difícil abastecer su tienda y realizar las compras de insumos para la cocina de fin de semana, por lo que pierde ventas en ambas actividades.
Su sueño es tener un mini-mercado en su propio domicilio. Ella desea realizar una ampliación en su tienda comprando alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor para sus dos actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Mariela solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad por mayor y ampliar sus dos actividades.
texts.en:
Mariela is 34 years old, single, mother of three children ages 1, 2, and 18 years. She has a convenience store in her neighborhood. Mariela is entrepreneurial, a good mother, hard-working, consistent, and responsible. Her store is located in her home near the Pirai river in the southern area of the city. This area is known for its river, a place where people gather on the weekends, rustic homes made of local materials, traditional food, and a place to play sports. Mariela has a dark complexion, long black hair, of medium height, and her first language is Spanish and she also speaks Guarani through her family's history (she is standing on the right in the blue shirt). She shares her life with her three children, the oldest is finishing high school and the youngest are still in the care of their mother.

She needs to expand her business in order to generate more income to support her family, This need has led her to form a bank with colleagues of different businesses and needs to seek a loan. This is her second cycle in the four years that she has been working with the business. Her main work is the convenience store with basic staple food items such as bread, sugar, rice, noodles, soda pop, etc. On weekends she makes small meals for those people who are coming to the river area. For example, she makes "majao" which is rice with cheese, fried plantain, and fried egg; or "masacl" which has meat with yuca and cheese; "el sonso" which is a mixture of yuca and cheese, etc. Since she takes care of her small children it is very difficult to adequately stock her store and make the purchases for the ingredients for the weekends, therefore she loses sales in both activities.

Her dream is to have a mini-market in her own home. She hopes to expand her business, buying basic staple foods at wholesale for her two businesses. For this reason Mariela seeks a loan to buy food at wholesale to expand both her businesses.

loans.use: to buy basic stable food items at wholesale for her store and catering businesses.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband, a vegetable trader, and her four children attending school. Five years ago, after taking into consideration the family’s financial situation, she decided to start her own business of cultivation. She grows her crops on a small plot of land where she takes good care of her goods to produce delicious and good-quality products.  Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase agricultural supplies. Leila tends to keep her hard work and looks forward to opening her own vegetable shop in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jose  Rodolfo

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de agua por las diferentes colonias y cantones desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para comprar llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión el cual es su herramienta de trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 49 years old. He lives in his own house with his partner. He has been selling water in the various neighborhoods and cantons for 10 years. He has many clients. With his earnings, he is able to cover some the costs of his household. He is requesting a loan to buy tires and to do maintenance work on his truck, which is integral to his work; in this way he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and gravel to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Angela Estela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 55 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos sobrinas ellas trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, Doña Ángela se dedica  a la venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado en su casa y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ángela is 55 years old. She lives in her own home with her two nieces. They work and help her financially. Ángela works selling pupusas. Her business is located in her house and she has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as corn, beans, fresh cheese, cracklings,  tomatoes, etc. so she can continue with her sales and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, cracklings, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sorbets and popsicles wholesale.

loans.name: Ainuska

texts.ru: Айнуска, 29 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Айнуски высшее образование, уже 2 года она занимается торговлей женской одеждой в арендованном магазине в центре города. Одежду Айнуска привозит из-за границы. Главной ценностью жизни она считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье детей. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат Айнуски, на сегодняшний день у нее широкий ассортимент одежды и наработаны постоянные покупатели. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнуска обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 3,000 долларов (USD) для покупки женской одежды для перепродажи, Айнуска приобретет примерно 15 платьев, 6 пальто, 6 костюмов и прочее. Она намерена увеличить ассортимент товара, привлечь новых покупателей, что непременно приведет к развитию ее бизнеса и увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Ainuska is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a higher education, and for the past two years, she has been selling women's clothes in a shop that she rents in the city center.  She imports clothes from abroad.  She highly values her family's welfare, the prosperity of her business and her children's happiness.  Thanks to her dedication, hard work and constant focus on her goals, she currently has a wide assortment of clothes and she has been able to attract a group of regular customers.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 3,000 USD.  She will use her loan to buy women's clothes for resale;  she will purchase about 15 dresses, six coats, six suits and a few other items.  She wants to increase her inventory and attract new customers, which will certainly enable her to develop her business and increase her family's capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale in order to increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es:
Saul, de 25 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas rápidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Bello, en este negocio vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas además de pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Saul trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es un joven muy responsable, juicios y aplicado con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

El pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Saul is 25 years old and has opted to open a fast food business near his house located in Bello municipality. He sells all kinds of fast food in addition to a variety of desserts. Saul works every day from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. He is a responsible young man, judicious and dedicated to his business.

Among his dreams are to be able to have a restaurant that offers various types of food and can offer work to others. He is seeking economic support to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour, and other items. The loan will impact his life and business in a very favorable way as he will be able to fulfill his dreams and will have a greater variety of food to offer his customers. In addition, he supports his two children through this business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, oil, flour and other items for his business.

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
Mariney es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos de 27, 25 y 23 años, y su negocio es la costura.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en el barrio ‘El Bajio’ caracterizado porque antiguamente se elaboraban ladrillos y tejas por la abundancia de arcilla, actualmente es un barrio que alberga a más de 200mil habitantes.
Mariney es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (al centro; usa blusa celeste, sostiene una hoja enrollada en su mano derecha ). Su vida la comparte sólo con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción porque sus hijos son independientes. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo. Debido a sus 13 años de experiencia, esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos. Su negocio es la costura, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa femenina, y piensa que tomando buenas medidas se asegura la confección de una buena prenda de vestir, medidas como el contorno; de pecho, de cuello, de cintura, de caderas, de brazo, etc. Son las más importantes.
Su sueño es tener su taller propio y generar empleos. Ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina industrial de coser y tela por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Mariney solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina industrial de coser, tela por mayor para ampliar su negocio y generar fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariney, 44, is a married woman, mother of three children, 27, 25, and 23, and her business is sewing.
She is enterprising, strong, a fighter, constant, responsible, and hard-working.  She carries on her work in the El Bajio neighborhood which used to be known historically as the place where they made bricks and roof tiles given the abundance of clay.  Presently, it is a neighborhood where more than 200,000 inhabitants live.
Mariney is dark-complected with long, black hair.  Her mother tongue is Spanish and she knows Guarani from her family (in the middle, she has a blue blouse and is holding a rolled-up sheet of paper in her right hand.)  She shares her life only with her husband, who works in construction, because her children are independent.  Her desire to get ahead caused her to form a bank of people with different businesses and similar requirements in order to request a loan.  Owing to her 13 years of experience, this is the fifth sequence of loans.  Her business is sewing  and she makes a living creating women's clothing.  She thinks that by taking good measurements, she is assured of creating a good article of clothing. Measurements like the profile, the chest, the neck, the waist, the hips, the arm, etc. are the most important.
Her dream is to have her own workshop and generate employment.  She would like to buy an industrial sewing machine and wholesale cloth.  For these reasons she requests a loan in order to buy an industrial sewing machine and wholesale cloth in order to expand her business and generate sources of work.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and wholesale cloth in order to expand her business and generate sources of work.

loans.name: Bahor

texts.ru: Бахору 30 лет. Она проживает на не большом районе Кубадиен. Она замужем и имеет детей. Дети учатся в школе, а муж не имеет определенного места работы. Бахор работает учительницей труда в местной школе. Также она предоставят услуги портнихи. Бахор начал шить 3 года назад и крепко держится за эту работу. Зарплата учителя в школе маленькая и доход от услуг портнихи является основным источником дохода в семью. Бахор старается улучшить качество своей работы, чтобы привлечь себе больше клиентов. На данный момент ей необходимо купить машинку- оверлок. Машинка помогает обрабатывать швы и крой одежды. Также на оставшуюся часть денег она купит ткани и другие швейные принадлежности. Бахор надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Bahor is 30 years old.  She lives in the small Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  She is married, with children. Her children attend school, and her husband doesn't have a fixed job.  Bahor herself works as a home economics teacher in a local school.  She also provides sewing services.  She started sewing three years ago and is determined to continue in this field.  She doesn't make much money as a school teacher, and the earnings she receives thanks to her sewing business constitute her family's main source of income.  Bahor is eager to improve the quality of her work and to attract a larger group of customers.  She currently needs to buy a sewing machine suitable for over-sewing, so that she can better handle the cuttings and seams of the clothes she sews.  She will use the extra money to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies.  She hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine suitable for over-sewing, and also some fabrics and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto cansado de buscar empleo y encontrar un no en cada puerta que tocada encontraba un no como empresa decidió iniciar su negocio de taller de monta llantas de bicicletas pues en su zona es muy abundante este medio de transporte.
WIlberto es un hombre de verdad humilde y la ayuda del crédito que está solicitando le beneficiara pues tendrá mejor equipo para trabajar y atender previsto que aunque suene exagerado ha dejado ir a clientes pro no tener 10 o 20 dólares para un repuesto y con este crédito tendrá buen material de trabajo para impulsar su micro-empresa.
Wilberto quiere tener un negocio estable que sea auto-sostenible y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilberto was tired of looking for employment and only hearing "no" at every door he knocked on. He decided to start a bicycle repair shop because in the area where he lives, this is a very common form of transportation. 

Wilberto is a man of truly humble circumstances. The help of the loan he is requesting will benefit him because he'll have better equipment to work with and to tend to customers. Though it sounds exagerated, he has had to let clients go because he didn't have 10 or 20 dollars for a replacement part. With this loan, he will have good materials for his work so he can go forward with his small business.

Wilberto wants to have a stable business that is self-sustaining and will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy replacement innertubes, tires, and cables in order to move forward with his business.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She has two children and lives with her husband who works in the Lebanese army. Her husband is the main income source of the family. His income however is hardly covering the heavy life expenses. Faten has decided to start working as a private teacher at her house with the aim of enhancing their standard of living. Faten wishes to buy a laptop. To do so, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas. s.a.l. She confirms that the laptop will definitely smooth her preparations as well as widen her knowledge. In the future, Faten seeks to ask for more Kiva loans to keep on supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Jose Osmin

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara salvasol que es una lámpara de carga con energía de paneles solares, dirigida principalmente a hogares del área rural que carecen de conexión de energía eléctrica, por esa razón está solicitando el crédito y poder comprar dicha lámpara y poder tener luz en su hogar.
texts.en: José is 36 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children. He works as a laborer on a farm near his house. With what he earns from his job, he is able to cover some of the expenses for his household. José is requesting a loan to buy a Salvasol lamp, which is a lamp that charges with solar panels. It is directed mainly to homes in rural areas that aren't connected to electricity. For this reason he is requesting the loan, so he can buy the lamp and have light in his home.

loans.use: to buy a Salvasol lamp [lamp that charges with solar panels].

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto nació en el año 1984 en un lugar llamado Santa Isabel. A la edad de dos años se mudó con su familia a la comunidad de Abisnia, donde estudió la escuela primaria y secundaria y ahí vivió hasta los 25 años.Actualmente Roberto está casado y tiene dos hijos. Roberto decidió estudiar teología y actualmente dirige una iglesia llamada Luminares, Roberto y su familia son muy queridos por los miembros de la iglesia. En esta comunidad no existe energía eléctrica es por eso que decidieron adquirir un generador de gasolina para instalarlo en la iglesia, sin embargo este hace mucho ruido y el gasto de combustible es muy elevado. Roberto y los miembros de la iglesia desean poder tener un sistema solar en la iglesia ya que este no hace ruido y tampoco necesita combustible. De esta manera podrán escuchar mejor las enseñanzas bíblicas y a la vez podrán tener luz y leer y estudiar mejor la biblia.
texts.en: Roberto was born in 1984 in a place called Santa Isabel.  At two years of age, he moved with his family to the community of Abisnia where he studied in primary and secondary school and where he lived until he was 25.  Presently, Roberto is married and has two children.  Roberto decided to study theology and now is in charge of a church called Luminares.  Roberto and his family are much-loved by the church members.  In this community, there is no electricity and for this reason they decided to acquire a gasoline generator to install in the church, however, this would make a lot of noise and the price of gas is very high.  Roberto and the church members wish to be able to have a solar system in the church since this does not make noise and doesn't need gas.  In this way, they will be able the better listen to the Bible teachings and also they will be able to have light to read and study the Bible better.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for the church.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos de 54 años de edad posee un vivero en su lugar de residencia desde hace 12 años, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Santos vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas plantas, abono, bolsas, tierra, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Santos is 54 years old. She has had a plant nursery at her house for 12 years. She has many established clients. With her earnings, she is able to cover some of the expenses of her household. Santos lives in her own house with her son. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more plants, fertilizer, bags, soil, etc. so she can continue with her work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more plants, fertilizer, bags, soil, etc.

loans.name: Isatu M.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Isatu M. She is single, and has two children aged seven and five years, all school-going children. In 2006, Isatu M. established her business selling wrappers, socks, flasks, towels, napkins, baby clothing etc. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le. 3,290,640 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le. 5,000,000. Isatu M. has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cartons of flasks, baby powder,  dozens of vaseline containers, napkins, soap, toilet bags, baby beds. She was fortunate to achieve her previous plan of building a house and improve on her business. 

In the future, Isatu M. is still planning to acquire a piece of land and build a house, rent a shop, reinvest and expand her business. This loan will help her greatly, as she wants to purchase more baby clothing and accessories. Her major challenge is the increase in prices of transportation and goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of flasks, baby powder, dozens of vaseline containers, napkins, soap, toilet bags, baby beds.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat, a talented tailor, is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. As already stated, Hayat works as a tailor. She has six years of experience in this occupation and knows how to manufacture stuff. Currently, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase tailoring tools and supplies. Hayat notes that these acquirements will certainly assist her in her business and will just impact her positively.

loans.use: purchase tailoring tools and supplies.

loans.name: Janaki

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Janaki is a cheerful and hardworking woman.  She is married and has three children (two sons and one daughter). She raises her children together with her husband. Two of her children go to school and the other one is too small to go to school. They live in the small village of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.   

Janaki’s husband is associated with a betel nut business. Janaki is involved in a business of sewing and needlework.  She learned the business from her mother. Currently this knowledge helps her to generate income for her family.  She sews women's clothing.  She earns a good income for the family. Her neighbors are her main customers. They appreciate her work. Thus, she has goodwill in her neighborhood.  

Currently, she would like to purchase a modern sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher quality clothing.  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes for a better result and dreams of having her own tailoring shop in the future in the market, where she can employ more women like her.

Janaki is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Gambo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Audu, Abdubasi and Abba. Gambo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Gambo expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Gambo to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Gambo said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children and, ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment.

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en: Hayfa is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. Five years ago, she started to work from her home as a food producer. Her products are well-enjoyed by customers. Presently, she wants to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase needed foodstuff and provision, as she wants to increase her productivity as well as her income. In the future, Hayfa tends to rent out a small store where she will put her products on view in a better way.

loans.use: purchase foodstuff and provisions.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 40-year-old man married to Annastacia who adds additional income to support their family and are blessed with seven children. Boniface has been a livestock farmer for the past ten years earning himself an income of KES. 5,000 at the end of every month.
  
Boniface was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer is now servicing his first loan of KES. 5,000 and intends to use this amount to buy animal feeds.

Boniface plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and to provide the best-quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Souknah

texts.en: Souknah is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children attending school. In 2008, she opened a bakery where she produces appetizing pastries. Her customers enjoy her goods in an unimaginable way. Today, Souknah seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase raw materials such as oil, flour, and soft drinks. She notes that this Kiva loan will unquestionably help her out to improve her production. In the future, Souknah looks to enlarge her operations to a greater extent.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as oil, flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to better store their food.

loans.name: Chhamiran

texts.en:
Chhamiran is 48 years old, married, and a loving mother of three sons.  One of her sons is in school in grade 12.  Her other two sons work as laborers on a daily wages basis. Chhamiran is illiterate and can only sign her name, but her husband has a primary education. They are underprivileged people who were deprived of an education in their childhood due to poverty.  They live in Khagrabari village in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Chhamiran's husband is fully associated with agricultural activities. He works hard on his farmland from dawn to dusk and produces vegetables, mainly potatoes.  He always tries to produce quality vegetables in order to satisfy his customers.  Chhamiran is a very feisty and enterprising woman who works as a day laborer. She also helps her husband sow and harvest the crops.  One of their sons is also engaged in this business.  He helps to carry the produce to the market to sell.   They thought about improving their cultivation because potatoes are in great demand and used in almost every dish every day in their region.

Chhamiran has taken a loan from BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers etc.

Her goals and plans for the future are to improve their agribusiness to improve their family economy and to use the profits to give her son a good education so that he can be prepared for life.

She appreciates the support of her lenders (BJS and Kiva)

loans.use: To purchase necessary agricultural supplies to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Hawanatu.  She is widowed, and has no children. She has three additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. In 2008, Hawanatu established her business selling engine oil, tires, filters, clutch cables, motor batteries, fuel pumps, brake pads, spark plugs, etc. She began her business because she was doing business with her husband. After the death of her husband, she took over the business.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,050,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy drums of engine oil. In the future, Hawanatu plans to expand the business. The loan will help to increase stock and generate more income. She is an ambitious and determined businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drums of engine oil.

loans.name: Goutami

texts.en:
Goutami is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and two adorable daughters in Vivekananda Pally, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She is a housewife and has a secondary education. Her daughters are in grade nine and grade five, respectively. Goutami's husband, 34-year-old Bidyut, is engaged in the business of selling saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. 

He opened his business a few years ago and has been doing this successfully. His customer demand is increasing day by day. Being the only earning member of the family, he gives his full efforts to this business to earn a better income. He runs the business from a small shop in his house. If he can buy in greater bulk, he will be able to achieve better prices and sell in greater volumes.

Now, Goutami is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband to buy different varieties of saris from the wholesale market to fulfill the demands of his customers. She expects a boost in her husband's earnings with the loan and her plans are to use the profit from the business for the betterment of her family members and to get ahead with the business. She wants to save money to give her daughters a better education.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of saris for her business.

loans.name: Alberto Javier

texts.es:
El negocio de Alberto es una distribuidora de la marca Bonice e inicio este proyecto este año cuando un amigo le hablo de lo rentable que era el negocio y más que iba a ser pionero en el sector de chinu.
Desde ese entonces Alberto es una persona con buen movimiento de ventas y ahora se enfrente a una dificultad pero de esas que dan alegría y es que en la empresa donde se abastece ya no tiene cupo y para cubrir su demanda debe comprar de contado pro lo que requiere un crédito para la compra de productos de la marca Bonice para no defraudar a sus clientes que han visto en Alberto una gran ayuda pues antes tenían que hacer largos desplazamientos para surtir su negocio.
Su gran sueño es seguir progresando y comenzar a coger vuelo, abrir varias sucursales y vivir cómodamente con su esposa e hijo.
texts.en:
Alberto's business is a distributorship of Bonice products.  He started this project this year when a friend told him how profitable the business was and that he was going to be a trailblazer in the Chinu area.  Since then, Alberto has had good sales.

At the moment he has some difficulty, but of the type that brings happiness: The company that supplies him won't give him more credit, and to cover his demand he has to buy in cash.  He needs a loan, however, to buy Bonice products so he doesn't disappoint his customers.  They have found Alberto to be a big help because previously they had to go a long way to stock their businesses.

His big dream is to keep on making progress and begin to take off, to open some branches, and to live comfortably with his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy products in cash because he has a lot of demand

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина 45 лет,замужем,мать четверых детей.Родилась в сельской местности и с детства помогала родителям по дому: выращивала овощи,смотрела за скотом,продавала молоко на рынке. В настоящее время она работает учителем в школе . Но учительской зарплаты не хватает.Она еле сводит концы с концами. Иногда она подрабатывает швеёй на дому. Но несмотря на это ,она хочет ,чтобы её сын поступил в высшее учебное заведение и получил хорошее образование. В этом году сын Дилафруз закончил школу,но  в настоящее время она не имеет нужной суммы для оплаты обучения. Поэтому Дилафруз обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Дилафруз выражает свою благодарность за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is 45 and married with four children. She was born in a rural area and helped her parents around the farm from childhood, raising sheep, looking after livestock and selling milk at the market. She currently works as a schoolteacher but her salary is insufficient and she is barely able to make ends meet. Sometimes she earns extra money doing sewing at home. 

Despite all this, Dilafruz wants her son to attend university and get a good education. This year her son graduated from high school but she doesn't currently have enough money to pay his university tuition. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for financial support. She expresses her thanks for the support and faith.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an educational course in order to increase her knowledge.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is a 31-year-old woman who lives in a remote region named Petkati, in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family. She has three children (one son and two daughters).  All are students. One is in college and the other two are in secondary school.  She has an eighth-grade education and works as a laborer on a daily wages basis.

Her husband, 40-year-old Supen, is a rickshaw puller by profession. He has been running a cycle-rickshaw (a cycle-operated three- wheeled vehicle for carting people, very popular in rural India) for the last 10 years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of his regular use of it. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income and he wants to buy a new rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore, Jharna has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Jharna is so thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To buy a cycle rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Kanu

texts.en:
Kanu is a 34-year-old woman who hails from Maynaguri. She is married and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). All of her children are students in different grades. Kanu's husband Ganesh is a mason by profession. They live in Upenpally in Jalpaiguri district.

Kanu's husband has a very inconsistent income, which is not adequate to meet all the expenses of a five-member family like them. Kanu always wanted to extend her helping hands to her husband to run the family well. She decided to contribute to her family by practicing cattle farming and started raising a dairy cow. She has been selling milk to her neighbors for the last few years. In this way, she tries to provide supplementary income to her family.

Kanu has been earning a decent income from dairy farming. However, the demand is overwhelming, and she wants to increase her dairy cattle. The biggest challenge is a lack of funds. So she is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, with which she plans to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow. 

Kanu will use profits from selling milk on her children's education and well-being. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Гулсара женщина-предприниматель из северного города Исфара. Она замужем, ей 41 год. Гулсара занимается собственным бизнесом. 5 лет назад она в своем городе открыла бильярдный клуб и управляет этим бизнесом сама, а племянник помогает ей вести дела. Гулсара хороший управляющий, она всегда заботится о своем бизнесе и о комфорте клиентов. Вот и сейчас она решила расширить бизнес. Гулсара на заемные средства собирается купить еще один бильярдный стол, так как количество клиентов увеличивается и необходимо уже расширяться. 
Гулсара надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку. Без вашей помощи ей не осуществить свою цель.
texts.en:
Gulsara is an entrepreneur from the northern city of Isfara. She is married and 41 years of age. She runs her own business, a billiards club which she started five years ago in her city and runs by herself with the help of her nephew. She is a good manager who is always concerned with her business and the well-being of her customers. 

Now, Gulsara has decided to expand her business. She plans to buy one more billiards table with her loan money, since her quantity of customers is increasing and she needs to expand. She hopes for your financial support, without which she would not be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy a billiards table for her club

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. su negocio esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Maria is 39 years old and she makes and sells snacks like french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc. Her business is near her home. Thanks to the sales that she has made, she can cover household expenses. Maria lives in her own home with her family. She is applying for the loan to buy the products that she uses to make snacks like oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all ingredients needed to make them and be able to continue supporting her family by covering the expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and all ingredients.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Ibrahim S. He is married, and has four children aged 20, 18, 14, and 10 years. Three are school-going children. He has no additional dependents. In 1998, Ibrahim S established his second-hand wears (house dresses, coats, footwear) business.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le. 3,270,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Ibrahim S. has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of footwear. In the future, Ibrahim S. plans to complete his building projects and, as he was able to complete it, he went on to concentrate on his business.  Acquiring stock in the capital city is his main challenge due to the isolation of towns from the city. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of footwear.

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.ru: Эркиной женщина в возрасте 50 лет она работает в областной больнице медиком. Она хочет получить кредит для оплаты за обучения сына. До этого ее сын ходил на подготовительные курсы что бы пройти вступительные экзамены в университет.  Сын Эркиной  планирует после успешного окончания ВУЗа устроиться на престижную работу. Также через 10 лет видит себя работником крупной преуспевающей фирмы, имеющий квартиру и машину. И мечтает о том, что к этому времени у него будет жена и ребенок, которых он будет обеспечивать. Она также мечтает что бы ее сын получив высшее образование получил достойную работу. Она считает что ее счастье и счастье ее детей в этих простых вещах о которых они мечтают. Очень надеются на поддержку от Арванд, что помогут осуществить их мечту.
texts.en:
Erkinoy is a woman of 50 who works as a medic in the local hospital. She wants a loan to pay her son's tuition. Until now, her son has gone to preparatory classes in order to pass his university exams. After graduating he plans to find a good job and sees himself in 10 years as an employee of a large, successful firm with his own apartment and car. He also dreams of having a wife and a child to care for.

Erkinoy also dreams that her son will receive a higher education and get a good job. She believes that her happiness and the happiness of her children is in these simple things that they dream. She is very hopeful for support from Arvand, which will help them achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand. gravel, and iron to construct a wall in her house.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 34 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a al venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace 5 años, vende de forma ambulantes por las colonias aledañas, tiene mucha clientes por la calidad de la ropa, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores, 34, lives in her own home with her husband and their three children. 

For the past 5 years she has sold men and women's clothing. She sells them door to door in neighboring areas. She has a lot of clients due to the quality of the clothes. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise at wholesale. This will allow her to increase her income and have more economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy men and women's clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes and trousers both mens and womens wear.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child attending school. Her occupation consists of serving her customers with delicious food produced at her domicile. Today, Sabah wants to get a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy materials needed for food-keeping such as jars, pots etc. Sabah is a very positive person and always seeks the best for her family and herself.

loans.use: buy materials needed.

loans.name: German Will

texts.es: Don German vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura, ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, German está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: German  lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. He has a paint and body work business located in his home. Through it, he works and covers some household expenses. German is applying for a loan to buy paint, varnish, oil, and other tools needed to continue working and generate a better income giving his family a better quality-of-life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oil, and other tools.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 26-year-old single man living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied until he reached secondary school, but he couldn't complete his studies.
 
Ashraf spent most of his life as a worker in a bakery, he distributes the bread to some restaurants and groceries in the city. The salary from his business is not enough to cover the necessary needs of his family. In order to provide his family with a better future, Ashraf decided to start his own business through purchasing a minibus to work on it as a driver to transport people from one station to another. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Ashraf applied for a loan of 450,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a minibus to work on it as a driver in order to earn money to provide his family with their necessary needs.

Ashraf  looks forward to purchasing another bus and renting it with his monthly salary to make a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan tiene 48 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, vive en el caserío las Juntas en el distrito de Pomahuaca, el caserío las Juntas es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería. Dicho caserio está ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Hernan se dedica al comercio cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, donde vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros; cuenta con más de 03 años de experiencia en el rubro, por su experiencia y su servicio cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de mercadería, capital de trabajo, invirtiendo en su negocio aumentando y diversificando su stock para poder atender todos los gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor y así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hernan is 48 years old. He is in a relationship and has two children, who are independent. He lives in a village called “Las Juntas”, in the Pomahuaca district. This village is small, but has the potential to grow. Locals work mainly in agriculture and commerce. Las Juntas is located in the Pomahuaca district, which belongs to the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Hernan is a businessman. He has a grocery store at home and sells rice, sugar, vegetable oil and other products. He has been doing this for more than three years. His business is located by the Olmos Corral Quemado road. His experience and good service has resulted in many customers, mainly locals and drivers that use the road. His neighbors can give good references of him as a person and as a businessman.

Hernan wants to use the loan to buy supplies for his business and increase his working capital. He will diversify and increase his stock levels in order to be able to better cover his customers’ tastes and preferences. This will result in good profits and the improvement of his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
A Sra Isabel tem 36 anos de idade, mãe de 02 filhos dos quais um estuda no ensino primário e o outro frequenta o ensino secundário.
Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar arroz, feijão, óleo, batatas, vorse para confeccionar refeições e fornecer nas empresas com as quais tem contrato de fornecimento de mantimento.O seu maior sonho é ver o seu negócio a crescer cada vez mais para poder ter o valor de reembolsar o crédito.
O seu maior desafio é de ampliar o seu negócio, firmando mais contratos com as empresas emergentes.
texts.en:
Mrs Isabel is 36 years old and the mother of 2 children, one of whom is in primary school and the other in secondary school.

She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, potatoes and South African sausages (wors) to cook meals for companies with whom she has a food supply contract. Her biggest dream is to see her business grow more every day so she can pay back her loan.

Her biggest challenge will be to expand her business, securing more contracts with up and coming organisations.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, potatoes and South African sausages (wors) to cook meals for companies with whom she has a food supply contract.

loans.name: Fatmata Razak

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Fatmata Razak.  She is married, and has 4 children. In 1999, Fatmata Razak established her timber, fillet and fisher board business. She began her business because she did not attain any formal education due to customs and traditions that a girl child should not be educated.  She joined her elder sister in her business. When she reached her adult age she got married and her sister also gave her husband some money to open a business for her and she started selling timber.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,469,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata Razak requires a loan in order to buy timber in different sizes. In the future, Fatmata Razak plans to reinvest and expand her business, and provide quality education for her children.  This loan will help her greatly as she wants to add more goods. Her major challenge is the delay in payment from debtors.  She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy timber in different sizes.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Hello lenders, the above picture presents Lois, 32 years of age, a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Chepkero, a remote village in Eldoret, Kenya. It is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has two lovely children. Her primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Lois is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling. The Eldoret area has conditions that favor dairy farming and Lois has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow but the lack of animal feed has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy animal feed. Through the loan, she will be able to have enough animal feed to increase her milk production. With the loan, her cow will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Eldoret area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Lois is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Lois to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Blessing and it consists of 4 members. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They are into secondhand clothing, kenkey (cook corn paste), fish, phone credit, plates and glasses. 

Patience is a 36-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children. The lady standing to the far right is Patience. Her husband works as a driver. She sells secondhand clothing by hawking from house-to-house and selling to her customers. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the town. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her town. Patience has a plan to grow her business so that she can meet her customers' demands. She also wants to purchase two bales of secondhand clothing from the main market and sell at her locality. For this, she has requested a loan to purchase two bales of secondhand clothing. 

Patience, along with her group members, are requesting a loan amount of 3,200 GHS to serve customers better.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of secondhand clothing from the main market and sell at her locality.

loans.name: Fatmata M.

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Fatmata M. She is married, and has 5 children ages 25, 21, 18, 15 and 11; three are school-going children. 

In 1991, Fatmata M. established her kitchen and household utensils business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 5,879,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata M. has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of rubber buckets, bowls and dishes. In the past plan, Fatmata M. has acquired a large and spacious shop. Her main challenge is transportation cost. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of enamel pans and other utensils.

loans.name: Fatmata Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Fatmata Ibrahim. She is married, and has 3 children ages 10, 6 and a 6-month-old baby; two are school-going children. Fatmata Ibrahim owns a charcoal and firewood business. She began her business as she learned from her mother. After she got married, she used to save part of the money given to her by her husband for food, which was accumulated and started on a firewood business. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 950,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Fatmata Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and bundles of firewood. This would be a help to increase her stock and generate more profit. Lack of transportation is her main challenge.

In the future, Fatmata Ibrahim plans to expand the business, buy a piece of land and provide quality education for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 27-year-old lady from Dhupguri in a remote region in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Tapas, aged 30 years. Minati and her husband studied till grade 6 and 7, respectively. Together they are raising their two children (one son and one daughter) with love and care. The children read in a primary village school.

Minati's husband is a farmer. Minati is also a very hardworking woman who pursues the domestic duties in her home and also helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Along with her partner, she grows potatoes, beans, bottle gourds, chilies, etc. They developed this business many years ago, and she learned along with him. 

Like other cultivators, her plans for the future are to expand her property and grow other crops in their farmland. She wants to cultivate paddy, which is a round the year crop, having much demand in West Bengal.

So, she is applying for financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc., to start cultivation of paddy. Minati hopes she will get an excellent result from this. She wants to utilize her income to support her children in their studies, since that is the best inheritance that she can offer to them.

Minati also aspires to purchase more agricultural lands and to provide higher education to her children in the future with the profit. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, etc., to grow paddy.

loans.name: Mario Martín

texts.es:
En la vida hay que ser atrevidos las cosas no vienen por si sola sino uno mismo tiene que levantarse e ir por ellas es la decisión de Mario de 38 años de edad, el a pesar de su avanzada edad a tomado la decisión de emprender actividades que le generen un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia, el tiene 5 hijos los tres primeros hijos ya tienen familias independientes y los dos últimos son estudiantes de su comunidad.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza bajo un sol agotador es de albañil en la comunidad donde el vive, el es buscado por las personas de su comunidad para que el les realiza diferentes tipos de actividades de construcción para poder el tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia, el viene realizando dicha actividad desde que tenía 18 años de edad y hoy hasta la fecha lo está realizando.

El uso que el dará al crédito es para la construcción de su segundo nivel ya que mucha falta le hace a su familia para poder tener las condiciones de vida que se merecen y que sean las adecuadas en un futuro próximo, la construcción de su segundo nivel es uno de los sueños de Mario ya que desde un tiempo atrás lo a querido realizar. 

Uno de las aspiraciones de Mario es que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida y conseguir más trabajos en el futuro de construcción para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
In life one must be bold, things don’t come along on their own but rather one must themselves rise up and go to them. This is the decision of Mario, 38 years old. In spite of his older age he has made the decision to start businesses that will generate him income for the benefit of his family. He has 5 children. The first 3 children already have separate families and the last two are students in their community.

The work that he does with dignity, under an exhausting sun, is a day laborer laying bricks in the community where he lives. He is sought out by the people in his community to do different types of construction work and this is how he makes an income to help sustain his family. He has been doing said work since he was 18 years old and to date, is still doing it.

He will use the loan to build a second story in his home since his family is in need of it in order to have the standard of living that they deserve and that will be appropriate in the near future.  Building  a second level in his home has been a dream of Mario's for a while now. 

One of Mario’s ambitions is for his children to become professionals in the different career fields in life. He also hopes to obtain more jobs in construction so he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: To build a second story on his house

loans.name: Fenina

texts.en: Fenina is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Goodness, Mercy and Yushau. Fenina is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, she expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Fenina would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Fenina can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.
