This allows Fenina to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Fenina said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees and food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
This is 27 year-old Fatima.  She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 3 years. One of her children is a school going child. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered. 

Fatima owns a business. She is a hard working business woman. She earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,500,000 SLL. Fatima has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bags of rice, benin, beans, gari and couscous. 

In the future, her new plan is to expand the business. She has started developing their piece of land from her previous plans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, benin, beans, gari and couscous.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is Bai.  He is married and has 5 children aged 13, 10 (twins), 7 years and 4 months baby.  Three of his children are school going children. 

In 2001, Bai established his clothing and footwear business.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 4,302,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Bai has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dozens of pairs of footwear for women. Bai's previous aim was to expand his business by adding another new product, which was successful. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of pairs of footwear for women.

loans.name: Irma Jeanette

texts.es: Irma tiene 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, perfumes, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar más productos por mayor, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Irma is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their three children. She is in the business of selling personal care products such as lotion, deodorant, creams, shampoo, perfume, and more. Her business is located in her home. With the money she makes, she is able to make ends meet for her household. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more products at wholesale. With this help, she will be able to achieve greater earnings and thus provide her family with everything that they need without limits.

loans.use: buy personal care products such as lotions and perfumes to supply her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of mayonnaise, milk, bathing soap, biscuits and torch light batteries.

loans.name: María Edilma

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 49 años de edad dedicada a ser comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares y amigos, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues desea realizar la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas) y ajustará el capital de trabajo con unos ahorros para poder comenzar a generar recursos en su trabajo, brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Maria tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is an active, enterprising woman of 49 years of age. She is an independent saleswoman who began by selling merchandise to her friends and acquaintances two years ago with the goal of supporting her household economy.

The loan will be used to strengthen her business through the purchase of stock (such as jeans, blouses, and shirts) at wholesale. She will augment her working capital with savings so that she can start to earn money in her work, providing greater comfort and better service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable.

Maria's lasting goal is to get ahead in her productive work. She wants to make it become a successful enterprise, guaranteeing a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy a supply of jeans, shirts, and more to supply her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete her certification in Accounting

loans.name: Aminata Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Aminata Mohamed. She is married, and has four children aged 18, 15, five and two years; two are school-going children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. 

In 2011, Aminata Mohamed established her pure drinking water, sardines, milk, cheese, fresh milk, and drinks, etc. business. She began her business as she dropped out of school after the death of her mother; her aunt introduced her to business instead of going back to school. When she was fully grown, she started her own business out of the savings she made from her aunt's business. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,020,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Aminata Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy crates of drinks and pure water. In the future, Aminata Mohamed plans to build another house, provide quality education for her children and expand the business. This loan will help to improve the business. She is a hardworking and committed businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Abibatu. She is married, and has four children aged 13, nine, six and two years; three are school-going children. 

In 2002, Abibatu established her food, palm oil and rice business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,177,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Abibatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of local rice. 

In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business. She made good improvement in her business as previously planned. Her main challenge is most of her customers cannot reach her due to the isolation process. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of local rice.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Abdul. He is single, and has two children aged 10 and three years; one is a school-going child. He has one additional dependent, who is his mother who helps to care for the grandchildren. 

In 2013, Abdul established his soft and hard drinks business. He began his business because he was fostered by his uncle and after he was grown and did not attend any formal education, he decided to go and learn auto mechanics. After gaining some experience, his elder brother established a motorbike business and he was helping him on commission which he gathered to establish his own business. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,520,500 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy a motorbike and crates of assorted soft and hard drinks. 

In the future, Abdul plans to reinvest and expand his business. The loan will help him greatly as he will buy more goods and improve on his business. His major challenges are increases in prices of commodities and transportation. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and crates of assorted soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different types of electrical appliances and electrical wires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a methane biodigester system

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Julia es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega cuenta con un negocio desde hace 6 años de venta de marisco en el mercado municipal de chinandega es viuda tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales uno esta a su cargo en edad escolar la señora inicia un dia de trabajo desde las 5 am hasta la 1 pm ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de variedad de pescado (langosta, jaiva,conchas,punche).

se le brinda el financiamiento cada tres meses para la compra de mercaderia es una mujer trabajadora ,responsable que trabaja dia dia para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia lives in the city of Chinandega and has run a business selling seafood in the city's main market for six years.  She is a widow with four children, one of whom is still in school and under her care. She begins her day at 5:00 am and works until 1:00 pm. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of seafood, including lobster, conches, and various crabs.

She seeks financing every three months for the purchase of additional merchandise. She is a hard-working, responsible woman who works hard every day to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, dry fish, and conches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR REGINO ES HABITANTE DE LA CIUDAD DE CHINANDEGA, ES CASADO TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, TRABAJA  DESDE HACE 7 AÑOS BRINDANDO SERVICIOS A LA POBLACION EN GENERAL EN TRANSPORTE EN SU TRICICLO, SE DESEMPEÑA OPERANDO DE LUES A DOMINGO DESDE LAS CINCO DE LA MAÑANA A SEIS DE LA TARDE , ES UN SEÑOR MUY RESPONSABLE, TRABAJADOR Y MUY HUMILDE  QUE TRABAJAR FUERTE PARA PODER LLEVAR EL SUSTENTO  A SUS HIJOS Y SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Regino lives in the city of Chinandega, is married and has two school-aged children.  For seven years he has been in business with his three-wheeled vehicle offering transportation services.  He works Monday through Sunday from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  

Regino is a very responsible, hard-working, humble man who does all he can to provide for his children and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tires and paint for the three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.name: Presentacion Yadira

texts.es: La señora presentacion yadira es habitante de la ciudad de chinandega es  casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de cristales desde hace 12 años es una mujer trabajadora , responsable que solicita financiamiento para la compra de mercaderia ella le surte todo lo relacionado con cristales a los diferentes restaurante de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Yadira lives in the city of Chinandega. She is married and has four children who are all already married themselves. She has conducted her business of selling crystal for the last 12 years. 

Yadira is a hard-working and responsible woman who is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise. She supplies the various restaurants in the city with everything related to crystal ware.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise in crystal.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 50 years old. She is single and blessed with one child who is 20 years old and in college. Gladys owns a money-transfer business called M-pesa. She has done this for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Gladys has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of 30,000 KES, which she will use to add float for her money-transfer business.

With the anticipated profits, Gladys will be able to educate her child further by paying the necessary school fees. Gladys hopes and dreams of living a comfortable and stable life.

loans.use: to add float for her money-transfer business

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Gaddafi and Maryamu. Rabiu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for farming inputs, Rabiu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, which is more than double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Rabiu to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Rabiu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 31-year-old man with a wife and four children all living with him. Godfrey is basically a businessman and solely trading agricultural products such as maize and coffee. He is a hard working man who has been able to achieve a lot from the business. More to that Godfrey is involved in agriculture and through this, he has been able to construct a permanent home and educate his children. Accordingly, he appreciates the services offered by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coffee.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is from the small village of Kamatpara, in Dhupguri, West Bengal.  She is a homemaker, 27 years old, who looks after her husband and four children. Three of the children are receiving an education and the other is too small to go to school. 

The couple has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Namita's husband cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and is an all-season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for the cultivation.

Namita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Namita to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest.  They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop is in tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of upgrading her house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for growing paddy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to register her professional degree as a teacher.

loans.name: Pushpabala

texts.en:
Pushpabala is a 47-year-old woman who is a housewife. She is from Dhupguri. She is married to Shambhu who is 57 years old and engaged in agricultural activities.  They have two sons who are studying for a B.A. and attending grade 11.
 
Their principal occupation is the cultivation of paddy and they depend upon this to generate income to cover their family’s various basic necessities. The product is sold in their region. Her husband is involved in the daily care and protection of the product; she is also involved in the afternoon, after she finishes household work.

Pushpabala is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost and good quality paddy seeds. She will use them to provide necessary care for her agribusiness.

Her goals are to be able to increase her production so that each season it will be greater than it had been in the previous one, and to improve her income day by day. She hopes she will be able to build up capital in order to work in her own way, and support her sons as much as possible, so that they might get ahead and be prosperous people. She dreams of upgrading their house with the profit generated.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies in order to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Fatmata G

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Fatmata G.  She is married, and has 5 children aged 20, 16,11,8 and 4 years, four of whom attend school.  Fatmata G owns a business.  She earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata G has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of wax cotton. In the future, Fatmata G plans to start a building project. She bought household furniture and also improved the business as was previously planned.  This loan will help to increase stock, but sales are slow now.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of wax cotton.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 2 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group called Ekomefeemo 2. The group is composed of women who know each other from family and neighborhood ties. They are family women with the average age of 40 years old. They live in large traditional families in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. 

The group members, like Philomina (who is standing on the left in the photo), work in the buying and selling of fish. They have been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and are highly sought after. 

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the ID Ghana's loan program. They are on their sixth group loan. The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,800 to enable them to serve customers better.

Philomina is the featured borrower of this group from Teshie, where she excels at selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy a large amount of fish. She procures her goods from the harbor at a wholesale price and makes her sales in the market at retail for cash to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn a good monthly profit which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling fish. She also wants to save part of her earnings.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of fish.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: la señor karla se dedica a la actividad desde hace 13 años de venta de mariscos y derivados como  chuleta de pescado, jaibas, huevos de tortuga, conchas, en los dos mercados, su actividad la empieza desde las cuatro de la mañana en un mercado y luego se va tipo nueve de la mañana al otro mercado hasta las dos de la tarde, es madre soltera de tres hijas sus hijas estudian  y ella se esfuerza por sacarlas adelante , su condicion de vidad ha mejorado poco a poco, solicita el financiamiento para comprar mariscos al por mayor y obtener siempre sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla has made a living selling shell fish and other seafood such as fish filet, crab, turtle eggs and mussels for the past thirteen years.
She starts working at 4am at one market and later, around 9am, moves on to the next, where she stays until 2pm.

Karla is a single mother of three daughters, who are all at school. Karla makes a lot of effort to get them ahead.

Karla's financial situation has improved little by little. She is asking for the loan to by shell fish in bulk and in this way increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy red snappers and other fish.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: el señor luis  se dedica a su actividad de venta de articulos de primera necesidad, granos basicos en su casa de habitacion desde hace 20 años, en un cliente muy esforzado, es soltero, tiene a su carga a un hija menor que estudia y a su mamá por las que se esfuerza por sacarlas adelante y por llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, solicita el financiamiento para surtir su negocio, y comprar al por mayor para mantener sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis has been working in his activity selling basic goods and grains from a room of his house for the past 20 years. He is a hard working client, single and in charge of his under-age daughter, who attends school, and his mother. For them he works hard to get them ahead and to bring home their daily bread.
He is asking for the loan to stock his business and to be able to buy at wholesale to keep up his profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
Yong is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and five daughters in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek District. Cassava growing is the only main source for her family’s income and she has been growing cassava for about 26 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 30,000 KHR but she is able to save 16,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Yong with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yong wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. With this loan, she hopes to improve her house and she also hopes to have a decent house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Istifanus, Manasa and Bilkisu. 

Hannatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Hannatu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Hannatu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Hannatu said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, pay child school fees, make food and farm loan repayments and eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Miria Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MIRIA est constitué de  7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt.  Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la seule femme assise  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 cartons de savon et 100kg de grains d’arachide pour la pâte. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes  de Bougouni et effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Miria group consists of seven married women who on average are 35 years old with five children. They live in nuclear families in the North Heremakono neighborhood of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity and bolster their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where they are on their first loan.

This group of women are retail merchants of various items like Fatoumata, who is the only woman sitting in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy three boxes of soap and 100 kilos of peanut kernels to prepare paste. She resupplies from wholesalers in Bougouni and conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and people passing by. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy raw ingredients to prepare juice

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matiyu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Miracle. Matiyu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Matiyu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Matiyu had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matiyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Matiyu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Matiyu said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my child is educated and is able to get a professional job."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Rashila

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: el señor Jose tiene su negocio de taller de reparación de motocierras desde hace 30 años  su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio santa ana, en su negocio atiende a la poblacion en general de lunes a sabado, solicita el financiamiento para hacerle mejoras a su negocio, en extender el techo del taller para ofrecerles mejores condiciones a sus clientes, su condicion de vida ha mejorado .
texts.en: Jose has had a chainsaw repair shop for 30 years. His business is located in the Santa Ana neighborhood. In his business, he serves the general public from Monday through Saturday. He is asking for a loan to make some improvements on his business. He will extend the roof of the shop to offer his customers better conditions. His quality of life has improved.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and chainsaws.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Joshua joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child: Timothy. Joshua is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Joshua expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Joshua would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Joshua to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Joshua said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment

loans.name: Aurel

texts.en:
This is Aurel (father) and Kristina (daughter, mute and deaf since birth) in the photograph; Aurel is seeking your financial help to pay for his 20-year-old daughter’s schooling fees who is going to study economics in a public university at the nearby city of Korca. Kindly note, that they are members of the ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians. 
Aurel is 46 years old and lives with his family in a village somewhat far from the main city of their district. He farms to earn a living; apple and plum orchards are his specialty. His clientele are wholesale buyers.  
Aurel and Kristina want to thank all potential lenders for their consideration.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees who was born deaf and mute

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: la señora auxiliadora es habitante de chinandega es casada tiene dos hijos los cuales son universitarios y ya no dependen de ella,  cuente con un negocio propio de venta de barriles plasticos, sacos vacios, pichingas desde hace 17 años,  es una señora muy luchadora, se esfuerza por tener el sustento de su hogar , solicita el financiamiento para surtir su negocio de barriles grandes, para comprar al por mayor y mantener sus ingresos
texts.en: Auxiliadora is a resident of Chinandega. She is married and has two children who are in college and do not depend on her anymore. She has had her own business selling plastic barrels, empty bags, and jugs for 17 years. She is a fighter who strives every day to support her home. She is asking for the loan to stock her barrel business, so she can buy wholesale and maintain her income.

loans.use: To buy barrels, containers, and empty sacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her college credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, gravel, iron, bricks, tile

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Villa Rosita Group

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es emprendedora, inteligente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en ‘El torno’ un área rural caracterizado por el comercio agrícola de semillas, ganado, etc.
Ana es de tez trigueña, estatura mediana, cabello largo castaño, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar (de pie a la derecha, usa solera roja). Su vida la comparte con sus padres que también se dedican al comercio y sus hermanos que estudian en la escuela secundaria. Tras haber iniciado su negocio hace un año se vio en la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida formando una banca de personas con negocios similares para solicitar un préstamo, Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos que solicita. Su negocio es la venta de ropa en un puesto de venta estable y bajo techo, su ropa consiste en poleras de dama, pantalones tipo capri, soleras, sudaderas y algunos accesorios, también tiene ropa de hombre como poleras y camisetas. Ella trata de variar su oferta y estar a la moda y necesidades de sus clientes. Su sueño es ayudar a sus hermanos a ser profesionales, y desea realizar la compra de un stock de ropa de ocasión por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hermanos a pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is a young 26-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She runs a clothes sales business.

She is enterprising, intelligent, reliable, responsible and hard-working. She carries out her work in ‘El torno’, a rural area mainly involved in agricultural trade of seeds, livestock etc.

Ana has an olive complexion, average height and long brown hair. Her native language is Spanish, and she also knows Guaraní from her family (she is standing on the right wearing a red dress). She shares her life with her parents, who also work in trade, and her siblings, who are studying in high school.

After having started her business one year ago, she needed to improve her quality of life by forming part of a communal bank of people with similar businesses, in order to apply for a loan. This is the first loan cycle she is applying to.

Her business is selling clothes at a fixed indoor stall. The clothes she sells are women's t-shirts, capri pants, summer dresses, sweatshirts and some accessories, as well as some men's clothing such as t-shirts. She tries to vary what she offers and to keep up with trends and her customers' needs. Her dream is to help her siblings to become professionals, and she hopes to bulk buy stock of occasion wear.

It is for these reasons that Ana is applying for a loan, to buy clothing in bulk, and with the profits help her siblings to pay for their studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk and with the profits help her siblings to pay for their studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and nails

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est constitué de 7 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le prêt précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de grains d’arachides  à l’image de  DJINESSIRA  qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 300kg de grains d’arachides avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group consists of seven married women who on average are 38 years old with five children. They live in traditional extended families in the Torakabougou area of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity and increase their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan was properly reimbursed.

This group of women trades groundnut kernels like Djinessira, the woman kneeling in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 300 kilos of groundnut kernels from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at the market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele. 

She expects average monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy groundnut kernels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles for his house.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: AMADOU est un père de famille qui habite à quelques kilomètres du guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans l’achat et la vente  de fer. Il est à son 4ème prêt et sollicite ce dernier pour acheter et vendre du fer. Il gère toutes les charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il a une expérience de plus de 20 ans, et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Il souhaite à l’avenir avoir un camion de transport pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Il voudrait en plus épargner de l’argent à coté et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Amadou is a father who lives a few kilometres away from the UIMCEC branch. He is married and a father. He is in the business of buying and reselling iron. This is his 4th loan and he is requesting it in order to buy some iron for resale. He is responsible for covering all the daily expenditures and his children's educational expenses. He has over 20 years experience and he starts his workday at 9am and ends it at 8pm. He would like some day to own a lorry so that he is better able to satisfy his customers. He would like to save more money and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron for resale.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.fr: FATEMA est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation des produits cosmétiques. Elle habite dans le même quartier que le guichet. Veuve et mère de famille, FATEMA  gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de ses enfants et leur frais de scolarité en même temps. Etant à son 4ème prêt, elle sollicite ce dernier pour acheter du lait pour le corps, des produits de beauté et des parfums pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir une boutique de produits cosmétiques dans le marché afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Fatema is in the business of selling beauty products. She lives in the district where the UIMCEC branch is located. A widow and a mother, Fatema is responsible for covering both her children's daily expenditures and their educational expenses. This is her 4th loan and she is requesting it so that she can restock her inventory with body milk, perfumes and other beauty products, and satisfy her customers. She has over 20 years experience in this line of work. Her workday starts at 8am and ends at 8pm. In the future, she would like to own a shop at the market selling beauty products so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as body milk and beauty creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay medical expenses for his wife.

loans.name: La Reine B Group

texts.fr: LA REINE B est un groupe de quatre femmes courageuses qui exercent diverses activités. Ce groupe de femme travaille avec ACFIME depuis Octobre 2012 et a toujours respecté ses échéances de remboursement. Bienvenue, membre représentatif est une femme dévouée, mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés.Elle est dans le domaine alimentaire puisqu'elle transforme le sésame pour vendre et cela fait cinq ans. Ce prêt aidera Bienvenue a acheter du sésame stocker pour sa transformation. Ce prêt lui sera utile car au Burkina c'est la période des récolté et elle profitera acheter sa matière première(sésame) à bon prix. Les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre soin de sa famille, d'épauler son mari et de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
The group "La reine B" is a group of 4 good women who run different businesses. This group of women has been working with ACFIME since October 2012 and has always made its repayments deadlines.

Bienvenue, the group representative, is a devout woman who is married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She works in food production, processing sesame seeds for resale, and has been doing so for 5 years. The loan will enable Bienvenue to buy sesame seeds for her food production business. This loan is especially useful in Burkina right now as it is harvest season and she will be able to buy her raw materials more cheaply. The profits will allow her to take care of her family, to support her husband and keep running her business.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for food production and resale.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Magaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yusuf and Fati. Magaji is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Magaji expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. When asked, Magaji said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, including his children's school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a young orphan with the responsibility of taking care of his siblings. He is involved into cattle rearing/fattening from his home area. According to him; he has been in the above activity for over twenty five years, and alongside that Moses is involved in cattle trade which also contributes to his income.
According to him through the above projects Moses has been able to buy land plus also take care of his family.

Moses has also acquired this facility to boost his cattle fattening business and retail shop business. Moses says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders. According to him, his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.

He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. Finally he appeals to Ugafode to continue availing him with money to boost his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cattle that he will fatten and later sell

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en: These are the members of the group called Veronica. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. This is their forth loan. These entrepreneurs are accessing loans from ID Ghana. With this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their families' standards of living. The featured borrower of this group is Veronica, age 36. She is single and has no dependent child. She sells underwear and children's dresses. She was born in Teshie, a town in coastal Ghana. She attended elementary school and lives in her family's house. Veronica has been selling underwear and children's dresses for the past eight years. With this loan, she will buy more underwear and dresses to add to her current inventory for sale. This is her forth loan with ID Ghana. They will need a total amount of 2,600 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more underwear and dresses to add to her current inventory for sale.

loans.name: Maritza Gabina

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer muy emprendedora que desde muy joven ha luchado por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja vendiendo verduras y también comida en su ciudad natal, Yungay. Es madre soltera de 4 maravillosos hijos que son el motor de su vida y por quienes día a día lucha para sacarlos adelante.
Maritza en estos momentos necesita comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio y también para su negocio de venta de comida, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para para comprar lo que necesita para su tienda, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto ayudará a incrementar sus ventas para poder apoyar a su familia. El sueño que espera cumplir es poder ver a todos sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is an enterprising woman who, from a very young age, has fought for her family's well-being. She works selling vegetables and also food in her native city of Yungay. She is a single mother of 4 marvelous children who are the driving force in her day-to-day fight to get them ahead.

Maritza, at this time, needs to purchase merchandise to stock her business and also for her food sales business. For this reason, she plans to use the loan to purchase what is needed for her store. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that with this, they will help increase her sales to be able to support her family. The dream that she wants to realize is to be able to see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her food stall.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Leatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Alfa and Alisa. Leatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. This allows Leatu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Leatu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu Liman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saidu Liman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bashari, Muhammad and Tatyana. Saidu Liman is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Saidu Liman expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Saidu Liman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saidu Liman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Saidu Liman to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Saidu Liman said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Abdel

texts.fr: Abdel jeune homme de 27ans est marié et n'a pas d'enfant en charge. Il est revendeur de profession. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des pagnes et produits de mercerie depuis 2010. Il s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé et sollicite un premier crédit pour renforcer son activité. Comme perspectives d'avenir, il souhaite agrandir l'activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Abdel, a young 27 year old man, is married and does not have any children in his care. He is a trader by profession. He has run a revenue-generating business selling pagnes (colorful wax cloths) and haberdashery products since 2010. He generally stocks up in Lomé and is requesting his first loan to strengthen his business. For his future prospects, he wishes to grow his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colorful wax cloths) and haberdashery products.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer muy trabajadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por iniciativa propia pudo abrir una pequeña tienda y vende todo tipo de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, insumos de primera necesidad entre otros. Gracias a esa tienda pudo sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos, a quienes desde pequeños les ha inculcado muchos valores para que puedan crecer como personas de bien.
Gracias al apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva, Catalina piensa utilizar el crédito para poder comprar abarrotes y así implementar su bodega, de esta manera tendrá mayores productos para ofrecer a los clientes y así sus ingresos puedan mejorar. Más adelante espera poder llegar a techar su tienda con material noble para mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Catalina is a very hard-working woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. By her own initiative, she was able to open a small store and sell all sorts of groceries such as rice, sugar, and staple products, among others. Thanks to this store, she was able to get her 6 children ahead, who she has taught from very young many values so that they can grow to be good people.

Thanks to the support that the Kiva lenders are offering, Catalina plans to use the loan to be able to purchase groceries and in this way run her store, in this way she will have more products to offer her customers and, in turn, her income will be able to improve. Later, she hopes to be able to roof her store with good quality material for better security.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Santos Nicanor

texts.es:
Santos Nicanor tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente tiene dos hijos de 4 y 3 años. Vive en casa propia de material rustico por un lapso de más de 20 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales, económicas y laborales. Santos Nicanor vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Santos Nicanor es brindar el servicio de carpinteria, elaborando mesas, sillas, etc., cuenta con clientes de la zona y alrededores, tiene casi 4 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio para la compra de uan cantidad mayor madera, para poder cumplir con todos los pedidos pendientes, y asi poder captar más clientes, incrementar sus ventas., mejroar sus ingresos y por ende su caldiad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Santos Nicanor is 24 years old, is partnered and has two children, ages 4 and 3. He has lived in his own house made of rustic materials, for over 20 years. He has good personal, economic and work references. Santos Nicanor lives in the rural part of Pucará district and has water and electric services.  This district is located in Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. His community basically works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and in trade. 

The work that Santos Nicanor does is offer carpentry services, making tables, chairs, etc. He has customers in the zone and nearby; he has almost 4 years of experience in the field. The purpose of the loan will be to invest in his business with the purchase of a large quantity of wood to be able to complete all of the pending orders, and in this way be able to attract more customers, increase his sales, improve his income and, in the end, his quality of life. In this field, there is no one better skilled in the zone and with it, he gets better prices.

loans.use: to invest in his business to purchase a large quantity of wood.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  NIETA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  fruits et légumes à l’image de  FATOUMATA  qui est la femme  assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 sacs de potirons et 5 caisses de tomates avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Nieta group is made up of six married women who are 40 years old and have five children, on average. They live in large traditional families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and business ties. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so as to better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with which they are on their third loan. The two previous loans were all paid back properly. This group of women, including Fatoumata, the woman seated in the photo, sells fruits and vegetables. With her loan, Fatoumata expects to buy ten bags of pumpkins and five cases of tomatoes with the wholesalers of Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which will be used to invest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de 4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de   pagnes à l’image de    BASSIRA  qui est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Benkadi group is made up of four married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have four children. They live in large traditional families in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the town of Bougouni. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and business ties. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so as to better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with which they are on their fourth loan. The three previous loans were all paid back properly. This group of women, including Bassira, the woman seated in the photo, sells pagnes (colorful wax cloths). With her loan, Bassira expects to buy 12 pagnes with the wholesalers of Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from home, at retail for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which will be used to invest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Manzama-Esso

texts.fr: Manzama-Esso une femme de 37ans vit à Lomé avec ses 4 enfants tous scolarisés et son mari. Pour prêter main forte à ce dernier, elle revend depuis 2007 des articles de mercerie et des pagnes de façon ambulante et s'approvisionne à leur ville de résidence. Elle a fait une quatrième demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Comme perspectives d'avenir, Mamzama-Esso espère voir évoluer son activité et contribuer à l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Manzama-Esso, a 37 year old woman, lives in Lomé with her four children, all of whom are in school, and her husband. To lend a strong hand to said husband, she has since 2007 resold haberdashery items and pagnes (colorful wax cloths) by foot, stocking up in the town where they live. She has made her fourth request to WAGES to buy merchandise in order to meet her clients' demand. For her future prospects, Manzama-Esso hopes to see her business develop and to contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colorful wax cloths) and haberdashery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory and at the same time to provide a new line of merchandise.

loans.name: Eugenia Lucina

texts.es:
Eugenia es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, y soñadora, con mucho esfuerzo pudo abrir su negocio de venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, de cuidado personal a gusto del cliente. Ella cree que le está yendo bien en su trabajo porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y es muy amable con los clientes. 
Eugenia quiere comprar más productos para poder surtir el negocio, es por ello que utilizará el crédito para poder comprar mercadería para su negocio, ella está muy agradecida por la generosidad de los prestamistas kiva porque con esto incrementará sus ventas y así seguirá sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a hard-working, responsible person and a dreamer. With much effort she managed to open her business selling groceries like rice, sugar and personal care items to suit her customers. She thinks that things are going well for her as she always makes an effort in everything she does and is very friendly with her clients.

Eugenia wants to buy more products to stock her business. So she will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business. She is very grateful for the generosity of the KIva lenders as with the loan she will increase her sales and continue to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, amongst others for her store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco viene de una familia modesta y comenta que su meta a alcanzar es  recibirse como médico y se veo como un anestesista cardíaco. Esta estudiando la carrera de medicina, se esta esforzando mucho para poder conseguir su meta tan anhelada, es un joven muy luchador y con muchos sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le será de mucha ayuda para poder solventar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco comes from a modest family and says that his goal is to become a doctor and specialize in cardiovascular anesthesiology. He is studying for a degree in Medicine and is working very hard to reach his desired goal. Francisco is a very determined young man who has many dreams.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. This will be of great help so that he can pursue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university degree fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for his store.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.fr: Revendeur de pièces détachées à Lomé depuis 2009, Norbert est marié et père d'un enfant de 04 ans. Il a louée une boutique dans lequel il vend des pièces détachées auto à ses clients. Afin de mieux les satisfaire, il fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit supplémentaires lui servira d'investir dans les besoins familiaux et de l'activité. Il espère vite payer ce premier crédit et prendre un autre pour stabiliser son activité. Norbert est âgé de 35ans.
texts.en: Norbert has been selling spare parts in Lomé since 2009. He is married and has a four-year old child. He is renting a shop where he sells spare auto parts to his customers. In order to better meet customer demand, he is applying to WAGES for the very first time for a loan to stock up on merchandise. The additional revenue will allow him to cover some family expenses and invest in his business. He hopes to pay off this first loan quickly and take out another one in order to stabilize his business. Norbert is 35 years old.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 69 años de edad toda su vida se ha esforzado por sacar adelante a sus hijos, actualmente mayores de edad que apoyan a la economía de su hogar, además junto a su esposo se dedican a cultivar granos básicos como: maíz, frijol, maicillo, además cultivan ayote, pipián, pepino, etc. Rosa desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que ella siempre velando por el bienestar de su hogar ha decidido cambiarlo, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, lamina galvanizada y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 69 years old and has spent her entire life trying to help her children get ahead. She is an older woman who contributes to the household finances. Rosa and her husband cultivate basic staple crops such as corn, beans, and sorghum. They also grow pumpkins, squash, cucumbers, and other produce.

Rosa wants to replace the roof of her home since it is currently in a deteriorated condition. She is always looking after the welfare of her household, so this why she has decided to make this change. Rosa is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in beams, galvanized sheets, and construction pins in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
29-year-old Sumita is a young and energetic housewife who dreams that one day her family may able to live in a safe and secure position. Her husband Bishwajit is engaged in agricultural work.     He grows paddy rice on his farmland and sells it in the local market through a middleman at a bulk rate. There is good demand for his paddy in local market as well as the wholesale market.

Sumita and her husband both studied up to secondary level. They have three children, two sons and one daughter, and all of them are going to school and studying in different grades. Sumita and Bishwajit didn’t want their children to grow up without proper education so despite their poor economic conditions  they always tried to support the studies of the children. 

Now they wish to grow more paddy rice in their farmland to earn more but the only constraint is insufficient flow of money.

That is why Sumita is asking for a loan from Kiva through BJS to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary products. The loan will help them to earn additional income to reach their goals. The increased amount of money may fulfill their dream as well as enhance their quality of life.

Sumita gives her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 22-year-old housewife who lives in a small village of Dhupguri called Kamathpara under Jalpaiguri district. She has two very young children, one son and one daughter. After finishing her household chores she helps her husband in his farmland. Sumitra studied up to grade four.

Her husband Ranjan is illiterate and engaged in farming and cultivation work. He is the main breadwinner for his family. So that the living conditions of their family may be enhanced and they may able to earn more, they want to grow more agricultural produce and their only limitation is lack of sufficient money.

Sumitra is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to develop their agricultural work. She wants to utilize the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, manure etc. That will produce an adequate harvest and enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers, thus they hope to earn more profit from this business. The loan will really help her to organize their business in more useful ways. Sumitra wants to help her husband economically and educate her children properly to establish them in their life.

Sumitra gives her heartiest thanks to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Lila Rosa

texts.es:
Lila Rosa tiene 30 años, es conviviviente, conocida en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de animales. Tiene 1 hijo de 01 año de edad. Vive con su hijo y su conviviente, quien es ingeniero agrícola y trabaja como independiente, él percibe ingresos de empresa de ingenieria. Lila Rosa tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Lila Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, entre otros). Ella desea crédito para la inversión en compra de animales para negocio, pues desea diversificar y aumentar su stock de animales. Atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar; de esta forma ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lila Rosa, 30, has a one-year-old child.  She's in a common-law relationship and lives with her son and her husband, an agricultural engineer who works independently and earns an income from an engineering company.  Her family is very close.  She lives in a community devoted to commerce, agriculture, and ranching located in the Cayaltí district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Lila Rosa has good personal and professional references.  She's known in the area for her work raising and selling animals.  She raises and sells ducks, guinea pigs, and other small animals.

She wants a loan to buy animals for her business.  She wants to diversify and increase her stock to respond to unmet demand in the area.  That way she'll expand her customer portfolio and have new customers as well as additional income for the family and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals so she can diversify and increase her stock

loans.name: Chhakina

texts.en:
40-year-old Chhakina lives in the village of Magurmari, in the district Jalpaiguri. She has four sons and only one of them is earning a living by mason work for the family. The rest of them are not engaged in any job, so that economic conditions of the family are growing worse day by day. 

In that situation Chhakina wants to contribute financially by helping her husband. Her husband Aliyar is engaged in cultivation work and he needs more money to expand his farming business. They have now decided to grow paddy rice.  Thus Chhakina is seeking a loan from BJS, the field partner for Kiva. With the loan amount Chhakina and her husband will purchase more agricultural supplies for the cultivation of paddy. They want to upgrade the quality of their farming produce so that their customers may be happy with that and they will earn more money to save the family.  

Chhakina and her husband also may be able to engage their other sons in paddy cultivation so that their volume of work may increase and they will earn more revenue. One of their dreams is to live in a concrete house which may be fulfilled by earning more profit from the business.

Chhakina gives her thanks to Kiva and BJS for holding their hands in the worst situation.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика, 43 года, в разводе, есть 3 детей. Сейчас Малика занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 0,30 ГА, где выращивает рис. Свой бизнес она начала 10 лет назад с 10,000 сом. У Малики также есть 2 коровы и 120 овец. Ежемесячный доход Малики составляет около 10,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. Сегодня ее доходов катастрофически не хватает на жизнь и воспитание детей. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Малика обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на закуп овец в целях откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса Малика собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Malika is 43 and divorced with three children. She currently works in agriculture on her own 0.3 hectare plot of land, where she grows rice. She started this business 10 years ago with 10,000 KGS. She also has two cows and 120 sheep, with a monthly income of about 10,000 KGS. She is a very honest, purposeful and hardworking person.

Malika's income doesn't come close to covering her costs of living and caring for her children. With the goal of further expanding her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminate sheeting, wood, paint, glue, sealant and a drill, indispensable supplies for his business.

loans.name: Mondi

texts.en:
Mondi just finished paying off the loan, and is seeking your financial help again. Recently, he has been repairing his family home and he had no money to finish the electrical and plumbing work. The region where he and his family, with two very young children, live is located in the northeast part of the country where the winter is extremely cold and snowy. 

For the sake of his children, Mondi is almost begging lenders to show some consideration to this matter, as they previously did.

loans.use: To finish repairing the home and do the electrical/plumbing installations

loans.name: Faridakhon

texts.ru:
Фаридахон 47-летняя жительница города Конибодом. Она трудолюбивая усердная женщина. На протяжении 3 лет Фаридахон ведет свой маленький торговый бизнес. Она занимается продажей кураги. Она обычно закупает высушенный абрикос, затем замачивает его в воде, отделяет косточку и сушит на солнце. Из него получается курага и затем готовую курагу Фаридахон выводит на рынок на продажу. 
Курага - это полезный продукт, который показан для профилактики множества болезней, поскольку он не содержит жиров и вредных для человека насыщенных кислот. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита Фаридахон является скупка партии высушенного абрикоса для изготовления и перепродажи кураги. Она ожидает вашей поддержки для продолжения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Faridakhon is a 47 year old resident of the city Konibodom. She is an eager, hardworking woman and has been running her small business for three years, selling kuraga (apricot halves). She usually buys the dried apricots, soaks them in water, removes the pit, and dries them in the sun. This is how she makes kuraga, which she then sells at the market. Kuraga is a useful product that can prevent a variety of diseases since it does not contain fats and other saturated acids that are harmful. Faridakhon is requesting a loan to buy apricots in order to make kuraga to sell. She is waiting for your support so that she can continue running her business.

loans.use: to buy apricots in order to make and sell dried apricot halves

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en: Surajo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Surajo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zakiyya, Mubarak and Nasaiba. Surajo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Surajo expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Surajo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Surajo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Surajo to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Surajo said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Fluturije

texts.en: Fluturije and her husband Hasan are a couple villagers who are requesting an 100,000 ALL loan to repair the roofing of their old house. “It’s been leaking inside every time it rained; the rains have already started in our region and we do not want to live the way we have lived for some time now,” said Fluturije in the interview. The couple have two sons and their youngest has some sort of mental late development. This photo was taken while Fluturije and Hasan were grazing their cows, far from home. It was not possible for the loan officer to take them to the house so that they could be photographed.

loans.use: to repair their leaking roof

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Japet, Sheba and Gashion. Emmanuel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loans, Emmanuel expects to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize which is double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With his loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the harvest market price. This allows Emmanuel to generate earnings of up to 1,000 USD per hectare which is more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Emmanuel said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, provide school fees, and eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con sus 6 hijos en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida y para su mantenimiento para sembrar papas. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es la falta de empleo. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old, is married, and lives with his 6 children in the canton Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar in the community of Nueva Esperanza.

He is a member of the Rural Cooperative Curi-Ñan bank, which is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza. The bank is focused on agricultural work and livestock.

Luis works in agriculture. He grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. He requests the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, urea, fungicide, and for maintenance for sowing potatoes. He will make the purchases in Guaranda. His goal is to increase his harvest and to buy himself a house. His challenge is a lack of a job. In his spare time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Buhuri and Nafisa. Inusa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, he expects to reap up to reap up to 30 bags per hectare of maize which is double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Saratu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.
