loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 44 and a married mother of three children, who are 20, 10, and 8 years old. They have recently relocated to a new home from a farther northern region that was covered in snow most of the year, where life was very difficult, according to Vida. 

Vida is requesting this loan to build a roof for the animal stable. 

Mainly, Vida practices agriculture and raises livestock to make a living. She plants corn, beans, white and red cabbage, spinach and leeks. In addition, she has a dairy cow with a calf at the moment, and pigs, chickens and ducks. She also has an orchard planted on her land growing figs, plums, pomegranates and grapevines; she sells the fruits to wholesale buyers. While she does all this, her husband works as a night man and helps her out as well.

loans.use: to build a roof for her animal stable, since there is no roofing at present

loans.name: Los Diamantes De Macamango Group

texts.es:
La socia Natalia pertenece al banco LOS DIAMANTES DE MACAMANGO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Natalia  tiene 26 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas como plátanos, naranjas  entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de cereales, agricultura, ganadería.
texts.en:
Bank member Natalia belongs to “The Diamonds of Macamango” bank, located in Santa Ana district, La Convencion province, in the Department of Cuzco. Natalia is 26 years old, single, and has two children. She works daily cultivating fruits, including plantains and oranges, etc. Natalia has been involved in her business for a long time, and it is going well, thanks to the efforts she puts into her business every day. She wishes to be able to continue working in this manner in order to continue aiding her family.

Natalia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She is very grateful for the offer of a loan and promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

The remaining bank members are also dedicated to agriculture, to selling cereals, and to cattle-raising.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La socia Basilia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta verduras, la socia lleva años dedicándose  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, tomates entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solictan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zanahorias entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Basilia continues working in her store that sells vegetables. She brings years of experience to this store which has been successful thanks to the determination she brings each day to her work. She sells carrots, tomatoes, and other products that her clients ask for, and through these efforts she is able to support her family. The member is asking for this loan to buy carrots and other products. She is pleased with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy carrots and other vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un agricultor con muchos años de experiencia y aprendió su actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres quienes fueron campesinos, Luis tiene un terreno al lado de su casa en donde siembra papa capira, papa criolla, coles, cilantro, y cebolla de rama, dichos productos los comercializa en las diferentes fruterías y legumbreras del sector. 
Luis buscando convertir su negocio en una distribuidora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de semillas de pimentón y cilantro con lo que tendrá nuevos productos y es que una gran dificultad es los altos costos de los insumos y aparte de que su familia está conformada por su esposa y 8 hijos.
Con la ayuda de este crédito podrá tener nuevos productos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes mejorando sus condiciones de vida y sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer with many years of experience. He learned his trade thanks to the teachings of his parents, who were also farmers. Luis has land next to his house where he plants red potatoes, yellow potatoes, cabbage, cilantro, and green onion. He sells these products in various fruit and vegetable stores in his sector. 

Luis is looking to convert his store into a distribution center, and wants to ask for this loan to buy paprika and cilantro seeds so he will have new products to sell. A great difficulty for him is the high costs of supplies, and apart from that, his family is made up of his wife and eight children. With the help of this loan, he will be able to have new products to meet the demand of his customers and improve his living conditions and his farm land.

loans.use: to buy paprika and cilantro seeds so that he will have new products to sell and help him care for his 8 children.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. John joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Gidiyon, Miracus and Mashan. 

John is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, John expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, John would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, John can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows John to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, John said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: improve his farm business

loans.name: God Is Great 1 Group

texts.en:
The pictured entrepreneurs are members God is Great 1 Group and are beginning their fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of five members. The members’ businesses include charcoal, groceries, tea, noodles and cloth. This loan will help their small businesses, including Shietu's. 

This is Shietu's fifth loan from ID Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling charcoal and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy three bags of charcoal from the wholesalers market to sell to customers. This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has three children. When asked what she likes abut ID Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total amount of GHS 5,900 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy three bags of charcoal from the wholesalers market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is single with two children. She describes herself as being visionary and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells towels and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are individuals living in Teshie. 

Gladys will use her GHS 1,000 loan to buy more towels and bed sheets to sell to customers. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman within the next 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy towels and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: God Is Great 2 Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called “God is Great 2.” The group has five micro-entrepreneur members and is on its fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Members sell phone cards, hair products, sugar, Gari, soap, groceries, and general goods. Constance is the featured group member. She is 38 years old and married with children. She joined though an invitation from a cousin who was a member of ID-Ghana. This will be her fifth loan. Constance has a business selling phone cards. She buys from phone cards agents and sells to customers. 

Constance is requesting a loan to buy phone cards from agents to sell to customers. She started her business with a little capital and it still needs financial support which is why she came to ID-Ghana. The “God is Great 2” group will need a total of 7,700 GHS to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy phone cards to resell to customers

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
Christo Nti Group is made up of two people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Diana, is 44 years old and has attended school to the secondary level. She is single has one child who go to school and under her care. 

Diana lives with her child and takes care of the various family's expenses. For this reason, she's been buying and selling shoes for both men and women. She has been doing this business for the past 10 years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself. 

Diana gets her supplies from the market in Ghana. To bolster her business, Diana, together with the other member of the Group, is seeking a fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble.

loans.use: buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Alh. Magaji

texts.en:
Alh. Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alh. Magaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yusufa, Mujittafa and Yahaya.

Magaji to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Alh. Magaji said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: improve his farm business

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Usama

texts.en:
Usama is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Usama joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Tijani, Amina and Zaharau.

loans.use: improve his farm business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor since 2006. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Sarah's 21st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe (local food vendor) stock and managed to open another two mamalishe shops in different places. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay for school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food ingredients for her three mamalishe shops. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Sarah will make sure that she pays her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her three mamalishe shops.

loans.name: Nestor Efren

texts.es: Nestor es un señor de 52 años, el es viudo desde hace 10 años, en ese tiempo  Nestor crio con mucho amor y responsabilidad a sus 2 hijos, en la actualidad Nestor vive solo y se dedica a trabajar a la agricultura y tiene una vaca, el crédito lo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca lechera  para mejorar sus ingresos mediante la venta de la leche, lo que este señor aspira es seguir trabajando su negocio, mejorarlo y así cubrir sus gastos diarios que son de comida, vestido y sobre todo de salud.
texts.en: Nestor is a 52 year old man and has been a widower for ten years. In that time, Nestor raised his two children with much love and responsibility. Currently, Nestor lives alone, works in agriculture, and has a cow. He will invest the loan in the purchase of a milking cow to improve his income through milk sales. Nestor aspires to continue working on his business, improving it, and covering his daily expenses of food, clothing, and above all, health.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mary, Bulus, and Luke. Matthew is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Matthew expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Matthew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matthew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Matthew to generate earnings of up to USD 1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Matthew said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children and, ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food, and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is Mabinty.  She is married. In 2005, Mabinty established her foodstuffs business (sardines, lunch meat, palm oil, rice).  She began her business because she wants to take care of herself and her family.  Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are all ages. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SSL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SSL. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice and gallons of palm oil. She hopes that this loan will increase her profit and capital. In the future, Mabinty plans to improve her children's education and enroll them in a better school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bags of rice and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Lombeh

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Lombeh. She is widowed. In 2004, Lombeh established her salon business. She started the business to take care of her children after the death of her husband. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Lombeh requires a loan in order to buy additional wigs and cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will increase her business and that she will have more customers. In the future, Lombeh plans to add more staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for wigs and cosmetics

loans.name: Namthone Group

texts.en:
Bualeevan's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Bualeevan's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Bualeevan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Bualeevan, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income available to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Bualeevan and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Bualeevan's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Denis Ernesto

texts.es:
Denis es conocido por su pueblo como uno de los principales proveedores de maíz y frijoles. A sus 30 años de edad tiene un hijo de cinco años junto a su pareja que lo apoya en cada actividad realizada en el campo. Desde hace diez años, este joven empezó en el mundo de la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles para consumo propio, proyecto que le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia. Antes él era ordeñador de vacas en fincas vecinas a la suya, actividad que en la actualidad sigue siendo como otra fuente de ingresos.
Denis sueña con llegar a sembrar más cosecha, pero sabe que necesita seguir trabajando fuerte, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar semillas de maíz y frijoles, hierbisida y abono para tener una excelente cosecha. Esto le permitirá comprar todo para aprovechar la temporada de invierno. En sus planes esta seguir adelante, aumentar las extensiones de hectáreas para sembrar y convertirse en un agricultor reconocido nacionalmente.
texts.en:
Denis is known around his village as one of the principle suppliers of maize and beans. He is 30 years old and has a 5 year old son together with his partner, who helps him work the fields. Ten years ago, this young man started out in the world of agriculture, growing maize and beans for his own consumption, a project that has allowed him and his family to get ahead. Before this he worked with cows on farms neighbouring his - a job he continues to do as another source of income. 

Denis dreams of cultivating a greater number of crops. He knows that to do this he needs to continue working hard, and so he is asking for a loan in order to buy maize and beans seeds, herbicide and fertiliser, so he can have a good harvest. This loan will enable him to buy everything in order to take advantage of the winter season. 

His plans are to continue making progress, increase the amount of land he has available to sow and become a farmer known throughout his country.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean seeds, herbicide and fertiliser.

loans.name: Wilner Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal Kuska LLankasun de Rumichaca Baja perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Wilner Jesús continua dedicándose a trabajar como albañil, él socio lleva años dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio continua elaborando  diferentes trabajos como pintar casas,construir,arreglar entre otros trabajos, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas para su trabajo.
El socio se siente agradecido  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Kuska LLankasun de Rumichaca Baja and is from the Urubamba province, district of Urubamba, department of Cusco. The member Wilner Jesús continues to work as a construction worker and has many years of experience in his work. He is successful thanks to the dedication he brings to his work each day. He continues working various jobs such as painting houses, constructing, and fixing, among other tasks. Through this work he is able to support his family.

The member is asking for this loan to buy tools for his job. He feels grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tools for his job.

loans.name: Naphong Group

texts.en:
Mai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Mai, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Mai is excited that she, like her group members, has been able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. 

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Mai. Not only is less income used to purchase charcoal and bottled water, but less time is also spent foraging for wood. 

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 47 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con su esposa e hijo de 18 años en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Maríano se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para criarlos y venderlos. Su meta es aumentar su negocio de cría de animales. Su desafío es las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mariano is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 18 year old son in the Guaranda canton, Bolivar province, community of Nueva Esperanza. 

He is a member of the communal bank, Curi-Ñan Rural Cooperative, which is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza and focuses on agricultural and livestock labors. Mariano works in agriculture and raises animals. His goal is to improve his business of raising animals, and his challenge is illnesses. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nakheuanork Group

texts.en: Sompack's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Sompack, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  Sompack is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Sompack due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and by decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jimmy Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso es un joven colombiano que reside en Ecuador, ya que comenta que en Colombia existe enfrentamientos entre la guerrilla y los militares y que también afectan a los ciudadanos, dice	que vino a Ecuador  en busca de trabajo y de una vida tranquila y que si lo encontró, el vive con su padre y con un hermano que es discapacitado  ya que no tiene sus piernas para caminar, Alfonso  se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo y  siembra pequeñas huertas de papas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de fungicidas y abono para mantener sanos a sus cultivos, lo que Alfonso espera es tener buenas cosechas para seguir sembrando en mayor cantidad y de esta forma tener más ingresos y seguir apoyando a su hermano que mucho lo necesita.
texts.en: Alfonso is a young Colombian who lives in Ecuador, because in Colombia there is conflict between the military and guerrillas that also affect citizens. He says that he came to Ecuador in search of work and a peaceful life, and he found it here. He lives with his father and his brother, who is handicapped because he is unable to walk. Alfonso works in the fields every day and maintains a small potato garden. He will invest the loan in the purchase of fungicides and fertilizer to keep his plants healthy. Alfonso hopes to have a good harvest to continue planting larger quantities of crops, increase his income, and continue supporting his brother who greatly needs his help.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Aminu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Fatima, Aliyu and Jibril. Aminu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Aminu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Aminu to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Aminu said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment

loans.name: Phonthong Group

texts.en:
Sanang is excited that he, like his group members, has been able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of waterborne diseases. 

Sanang's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams. However, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. 

Even though some people in the village, including Sanang, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users since they spend less on bottled water. Sanang and other filter-users also buy less charcoal fuel used to boil water and spend less time foraging for firewood. 

Sanang's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. 

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. They not only see an increase in time available for productive work, but also an improvement in the family's income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mizraim Frecia

texts.es:
La socia Mizraim Frecia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mizraim Frecia is still working in the business of selling natural products. She works from 8.00 am until 5.00pm. She has been running this business for four years now, and it is going very well.

Her dream is to expand the business selling natural products. She is asking for the loan to buy natural products.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Zhiydegul

texts.ru: Жийдегул, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Жийдегул- среднее образование, работает уборщицей в школе, также  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав более 20 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Жийдегул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 1 бычок, 2 лошади, 2 коровы и 5 овец. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 1,2 ГА она выращивает клевер, ячмень и пшеницу. На зиму подготовлены сараи для скота, заготовлено 300 тюков сена, 2 тонны ячменя и 1 тонна пшеницы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жийдегул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки овец и нетелей. Жийдегул намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи скота и мяса. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhiydegul is 45 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Zhiydegul has a secondary-specialized education and works as a janitor at a school. Also, to provide additional income for her family, she is involved in farming and animal husbandry, having started this business over 20 years ago. Thanks to Zhiydegul's drive and hard work, today her business contains 1 bull, 2 horses and 5 sheep. She also grows clover, barley and wheat on her own land of 1.2 hectares. She has already prepared barns for livestock, 300 bales of hay, 2 tons of barley and 1 ton of wheat for the winter. In order to further develop her business, Zhiydegul requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to sheep and heifers. Zhiydegul intends to increase her livestock headcount, which would lead to earning a bigger aggregate profit from reselling livestock and meat. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional heifers and sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 29 лет, замужем, мать 2 маленьких детей. У Дамиры - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2009 году. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Дамиры, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дамира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров, от реализации которых она сможет получить большую прибыль, что приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Damira is 29, married, and the mother of two young children. She has a secondary education and raises livestock as an additional source of income for her family, which she started in 2009. Thanks to her dedication and hard work she currently has four cows and earns around 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Damira asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to sell in order to earn more income for her family. She plans to use the profits to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rebecca joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Joshua, John and Daborah. Rebecca is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution for ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of her previous loan for inputs, she expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rebecca would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after the harvest, in order to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Rebecca to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare - more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Rebecca said, “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses and pay for child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices, and thus increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
Animalye, who is in her late 20s, is single. She has been selling fish for three years. She works from 04am to 04pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Animalye's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a TV set, a deck, and a fridge, and she paid rent for her house and covered household expenses. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support. She will use this new loan to buy fish, cooking oil, and charcoal, and to pay rent for a new place for selling her fish. She dreams of buying a plot of land.

Animalye will share this loan with her loan group, Mistubishi, which is comprised of four members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil, and charcoal, and to pay rent on a new place for selling her fish.

Bounsong is excited that, like the other members of his group, he was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne causes of disease.

Some people in Bounsong's village are able to buy bottled water, but the water filter increases its users' disposable incomes, by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Bounsong and other filter users also will decrease the amount of money they would otherwise spend to buy charcoal for boiling water, and spend less time foraging for firewood. Bounsong's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so his family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child, Shitu. Elizabeth is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Elizabeth expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Elizabeth would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elizabeth can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Elizabeth to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Elizabeth said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Reuben, Ziphora and Alheri. Maryamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Maryamu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Maryamu to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Maryamu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock.

Analyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is married and she has four children. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has the business shop in her house. Silvia has been involved in business activities since 1994. She started with her own working capital of $20. She is earning a good income every day because many people like to buy her goods, so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan to improve her management for her business because she wants to run her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk, sardines, candles, soap, noodles, biscuits, candies, cigarettes, slippers and other things to sell Including soft drinks.

loans.name: Luis Alberto Fernando

texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a Kubo.financiero client, and this is his story. Luis is 21 years old and is single. He makes a living by selling costumes. Initially, this business was owned by his mother. Later, his family established another location in the street, and he was left attending the original one. The original one is located inside a market, and Luis has been there for five years, now.

In the stand he sells masks, make-up, and full costumes for all types of parties or events. He asks for this loan to stock up his business, especially because Halloween is coming up. This holiday is widely celebrated in Mexico; this represents a good sales season for him.

Presently, the effort Luis puts into his work enables him to contribute to the family living expenses. He looks forward to increasing his standard of living and expanding his business.

loans.use: to stock up his costume-selling business, since Halloween is coming up.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en:
Constantina is applying for a loan of $600. She has a kiosk and she is a businesswoman. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to add to her kiosk inventory, including shampoo, rubber, sugar, coffee, salts, sweets, biscuits, noodles, sardines, cooking oils, soaps, toothpaste, milks, and other things to sell.

She started her business in 2013 with working capital. Her plan for the future is to open a bigger store, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to have good management capacity for her business and than to increase her income in the future. She is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin has offered her as it enables her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rubber, sugar, coffee, salts, sweets, biscuits, noodles, sardines, cooking oils, soaps, toothpaste, milks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Lukman, Kamal and Jibrin. 

Isiyaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Isiyaku expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Isiyaku to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Isiyaku said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%.

loans.name: Dúo Vencedores De Cristo Group

texts.es: Dúo Vencedores de Cristo La señora Amanda de 63 años de edad es la encargada de este grupo, desde hace  19 años inicia su negocio como vendedora ambulante de ropa variada nueva y usada, hoy en día también tiene venta de leña por raja y carga.  Contando con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y el amor incomparable de sus hijos tiene un local en la calle principal y es muy conocida por el pueblo.  Su sueño es llegar a ser una gran distribuidora de ropa de paca y ayudar a las mujeres a salir adelante.  Es la temporada de frio en el pueblo y varias personas le han pedido chumpas, suéteres, blusas de manga larga y botas para damas, caballeros y niños pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza, por eso necesita hacer un préstamo y comprar lo que le falta para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y aprovechar las ventas.
texts.en:
Amanda, 63, is in charge of this group, Vencedores de Cristo Duo.  She started her business 19 years ago as a street vendor selling a variety of new and used clothing.  Currently she also sells firewood by the piece and by the load.  With her husband's unconditional support and her children's incomparable love, she has a locale on the main street and is well known in town.  Her dream is to become a large distributor of clothing bundles and help women get ahead.

It's the cold season in town and several people have ordered jackets, sweaters, long-sleeved blouses, and boots for men, women, and children.  Amanda doesn't have enough money, Therefore, she needs a loan to buy what she's lacking.  That way she won't let down her customers and she'll make the most of the sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a septic tank, toilet, and buy a water tank.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is determined to pursue her farming activities. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for her needed capital. She is happy that she is able to avail herself of the various programs and services that PMPC offers. 

Recently, Charlita availed herself of a loan for the next cropping season. She took a loan to pay for land and seed-bed preparation for another source of income, to sustain the studies of her children. 

Charlita perseveres and always strives to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed-bed preparation.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Apolonia works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Apolonia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native mat business.

Apolonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native mat business.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is a 59-year-old widow with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Esterlina has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy an additional bicycle.

Esterlina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 50-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Crispina has a business selling bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more bags to sell.

In the future, Crispina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 62 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Flordeliza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben describes himself as a responsible and hardworking person who is 100% dedicated to his family and business. He is married and takes care of two children. Ruben has been the owner of a shoe workshop, called Calzado Sofi, for almost eight years, now. The main purpose of this loan is to be able to increase shoe production, with an investment in new leather materials. This will enable Ruben to satisfy the demand his business generates.

loans.use: to buy more materials for shoe-making, including leather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install running water in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a sewer outside, a toilet, and bath within the bedroom.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Pour acheter un véhicule d’occasion et des pièces détachées auto, Mr Komi demande un troisième crédit à WAGES. Il est revendeur et mécanicien auto. L'objectif poursuivi est d'améliorer la taille de l'activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille. Sa femme est enseignante et père de 02 enfants scolarisés de 12 et 8ans.
texts.en: In order to buy a used car and spare auto parts, Mr. Komi is asking for a third loan from WAGES. He is a reseller and auto mechanic. The given goal is to improve the size of his business and to ensure that his family thrives. His wife is a teacher, and he is the father of a 12-year-old and an 8-year-old, both of whom attend school.

loans.use: to buy a used car and spare auto parts

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gerlyn is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Gerlyn has a business selling native bags in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of native bags to offer for sale.

Gerlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old, married and has eight children. Three of her children are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock.

Marilyn has been raising livestock for twenty years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 56-year-old married woman with nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Alicia has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Nandtaabe Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Tinsyande est le représentant du groupe NANDTAABE  SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants, le plus âgé a 50 ans et le moins âgé a 30 ans. 0 va à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur-éleveur depuis 50 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 01 sac d’haricots, 10 poules et 02 rouleaux de fils.
Monsieur  Tinsyande veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre son activité et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Tinsyande is the representative of the NANDTAABE  SILGO group. He gets on very well. He is a married father of six, the eldest of whom is 50 and the youngest of whom is 30. None attend school. He is responsible for four people. Mr. Tinsyande has been a farmer for 50 years. He stocks up at his neighborhood market. His customers are the people who live in his neighborhood. He wants to buy one sack of beans, ten hens, and two rolls of wire. Mr. Tinsyande wants to use his earnings to grow his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy one sack of beans, ten hens, and two rolls of wire

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, and raw materials to make Nacatamales and roasted meats.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
This is Mary Joy. She is 36 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mary Joy operates a market stall. She sells fresh meat and vegetable produce in the community market. She buys quantities of fish, chicken and vegetables and sells these items by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fish, chicken and frozen/processed food products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Joy desires to have a bigger space for her stall in the market. She hopes for good health and sufficiency for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week in a setting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish, chicken, and processed food products.

loans.name: Grupo Las Trabajadoras Del Caserio Central Xajaxac Group

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como vendedora de abarrotería en una tienda.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 20 años de edad mujer emprendedora y decidida a enfrentar la realidad de la vida, ella cuenta con tres hermanos por los cuales ella tiene realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener  a su familia. (María se encuentra en medio del grupo  en la fotografía)

La actividad productiva que María realiza es la compra y venta de  abarrotería, ella decidida a realizar esta actividad porque es rentable y hay pocas personas que realizan esta actividad en su comunidad, ella viene realizando dicha actividad desde hace 3 años y le ha dejado muy buena ganancia para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Ella es una gran mujer emprendedora y líder en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha decidido a emprender el negocio junto a ella para que ellas también mejoren sus condiciones de vida de sus familias.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería ya que para ella es de mucha importancia para poder desempeñar su actividad de cada día ya que es el medio en la que ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es ahorrar para un futuro construir casas para sus hermanos  para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada y dar estudio a sus hermanos y que ellos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida.
texts.en:
the life gave Maria the opportunity to work as a saleslady in a grocery store.  It was what she had hoped for: not only a door opening, but a chance to see what lay beyond the door.  And what she found was what she wanted to be.  She is a 20-year-old, determined, enterprising woman who has taken on life.  She has three siblings and must make an enormous effort to support her family (Maria is the one in the middle in the picture).

Maria does the buying and the selling at the grocery store.  She decided on this business because it is profitable and there are few people doing this in her community.  She has been in business for three years and has earned a good profit to support her family.

She is a great entrepreneur and a leader in the community. Therefore a group of women decided to go into business with her to improve the living conditions of their families.

She will use the loan to buy grocery store merchandise which is important for her business and in order for her to earn an income for her family.

One of her goals is to save money to build houses for her siblings in the future so they have decent living conditions.  She also wants to give them an education so they can become professionals in their different careers.

loans.use: to buy grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 21 years old and married with one child. Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Helen has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more charcoal to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU est une femme promotrice qui habite dans un quartier non loin du Guichet .Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle a un parent bénéficiaire de crédit dans la même institution et elle est à son 3ème prêt.  Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des habillements  et a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité.  Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle demande ce montant  pour acheter et vendre des habits pour hommes et femmes. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite avoir une boutique cosmétique au marché centrale et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi, elle pourra diversifier ses produits et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: ASTOU is a female promoter who lives in a neighborhood not far from Guichet. She is a married mother. She has a relative who has a loan at the same institution, and she is on her third loan. She has been progressing in selling clothes and has more than 5 years of experience in it. She helps her husband in handling the daily expenses and her children’s school fees. She is asking for this amount to buy and sell men’s and women’s clothing. She starts her day at 9am and finishes at 7pm. In the future, she hopes to have a cosmetics boutique at the central market to augment her revenues. Thus, she will be able to diversify her products and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Seune Ndiaye

texts.fr: SEUNE NDIAYE est un femme de ménage très brave, qui évolue dans la commercialisation des produits cosmétiques.  Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite à coté du guichet et n’a pas de parents bénéficiaires dans l’institution. Elle est à son 6ème prêt et demande ce montant pour acheter des laits de beauté et des savons ainsi que des parfums pour les revendre à ses clients. Il a une expérience de 10 ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait avoir une table au marché centrale de thies pour pouvoir diversifier son marchandise. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus, épargner de l’argent à coté et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: SEUNE NDIAYE is a very brave housewife who has been progressing in selling cosmetic products. She is a married mother. She lives next to where the UIMCEC branch is located and has no relatives with a loan at the institution. She is on her sixth loan and is seeking this sum to buy beauty lotions and soaps, as well as perfumes to resell to her customers. She has ten years of experience in this business and starts her day at 10am to finish it at 5pm. In the future, she would like to have a table at the central market in Thies in order to be able to diversify her merchandise. She will thus be able to increase her revenues, save some money, and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: 030306120001.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Thành works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Thành is 56 years old and she is married, with one child. She is the group leader of the 030306120001.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thành has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thành hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Charleen

texts.en:
Charleen is 29 years old and married, with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Charleen is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Charleen has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as coffee, sugar,  noodles, cooking oils, biscuits and other things to sell, including clothes. 

Elisa opened her kiosk a few years ago with her own working capital. Now she is also selling clothes like sweatpants, pants, t-shirts for kids, and other things. She hopes to open a bigger store, so she is taking this loan to add more items to her inventory, according to what people like. 

Elisa is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered to her. She said that with this loan she can improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar,  noodles, cooking oils, biscuits and other things to sell, including clothes.

loans.name: Jessenia Lisseth

texts.es: Jessenia es madre soltera, ella tienen 23 años y su hijo 4 años, Jessenia vive en la casa de su abuelita y son 4 años que se dedica a la venta de edredones, ella ofrece su producto de puerta a puerta y también a sus familiares y amigas, lo que hace que le vaya bien en su negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de edredones para seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su hijo ya que no tiene el apoyo del padre de su niño, Jessenia aspira mejorar su negocio y tener los ingresos suficientes para darle lo necesario a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jessenia is 23 years old and is a single mother to a 4-year-old son. Jessenia lives in her grandmother's house and has worked selling quilts for 4 years. She offers her product door-to-door and also to her family and friends, which means that her business is going very well. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of quilts, in order to continue working and move forward with her son, as she does not receive any support from her son's father. Jessenia hopes to improve her business and have sufficient income to give her son everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy quilts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Ayllupampa en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
 La socia Nancy tiene 32 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades trabajando en  una empresa estatal, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de víveres y bienes de consumo para su hogar.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The associate Nancy belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosia de Ayllupampa. The bank is located in the Ayllupampa community in the Urubamba province and the department of Cuzco. 

The associate Nancy is 32 years old, single, and has one child. The associate alternates her activities working at a state company. The associate spends a lot of time at her work, which does well thanks to the determination that she puts in every day to her work. The associate wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. 

The associate asks for the loan for the purchase of food and consumer goods for her home.

The associate feels grateful for the given loan and she promises to fulfill all the established fees.

loans.use: to purchase food and consumer goods for her home

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con su madre y sus hermanas en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia, la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado.  Edith se dedica a la atencion de una tienda de barrio y tiene otro trabajo como funcionaria publica. Edith hace grandes esfuerzos, puesto que debe cargar cosas pesadas (mercaderia)  y llevarlas a ferias locales Edith quiere un prestamo para invertir en su tienda y comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderia Edith cuenta con el apoyo de su madre pero eso no es suficiente, por eso quiere su ayuda  Edith goza de buena salud y es muy emprendedora, esperamos que puedan colaborar con su emprendimiento
texts.en:
Edith is single and does not have children. She lives with her mother and her sisters in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to her family. The house has electricity, water, and plumbing.

Edith makes her living working at a neighborhood store. She has another job as a civil servant. Edith works hard, since she has to cary heavy things (merchandise) and take them to local fairs.

Edith wants a loan to invest in her store and to buy a greater quantity of merchandise. Edith gets support from her mother, but it is not enough, which is why she wants your help. Edith enjoys good health and is very enterprising. We hope that you can contribute to her undertaking.

loans.use: to invest in her store and to buy a greater quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, esta estudiando la carrera de fisioterapia.
El quiere ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo y también poder crecer y mantenerse a si mismo.
El pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Roberto is from the city of Carapeguá, and he is studying Physiotherapy. He wants to help other people through his work and also grow and support himself. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition and in this way continue with the work he has been doing. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving and the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La socia Emma se dedica al  trabajo como contadora, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Emma works as an accountant. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has been doing this work for several years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell clothing.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy a television set for her house. She is happy for the loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house.

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn owns and manages cottages and spaces for rent in Siquijor, Philippines. This has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase construction materials for her cottages and spaces to provide a safe and comfortable stay and be able to draw more occupants. This will help her in sustaining the needs of the family and her children's education. 

She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to have a commercial building in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her cottages and spaces to provide a safe and comfortable stay and be able to draw more occupants.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is a farmer in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Previously, she borrowed a loan for her rice production. Luckily, her farming activities brought her good fortune. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital.

Recently she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs, including fertilizer, for the next cropping season. Ofelia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, including fertilizer, to increase her harvest yield

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita, from Same, is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities for a few years with her own working capital and she does her best with it. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has a bigger store but she is still requesting the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management for her business. She is taking a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more items to keep in her store including shampoo, detergent, candy, tea, umbrellas, rice, coffee, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent, candy, tea, umbrellas, rice, coffee, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 58 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years she has raised pigs to sell.

Trinidad has taken out and successfully repaid five loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 13,000 PHP loan in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She plans to continue working on and building her pig business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Divina has been farming rice for eight years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 51 years old and a widow, with five children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, noodles, rice, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia Anita se dedica al negocio de venta de refrescos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los refrecos.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar refrescos.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Anita works in beverage sales. She works from 8 am until 5 pm, and through this business, she wishes to improve her living circumstances. Her dream is to have her own place where she can sell beverages. The member is asking for a loan to buy beverages. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba., perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
 El socio es el Sr. Miguel Arcángel; ; El socio continua dedicándose a la venta de madera, el socio lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor. 
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the communal bank, "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa." The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, department of Cusco. 

The member is Mr. Miguel Arcángel, who continues to work in wood sales. He has years of experience with this business, which is successful thanks to the dedication he brings to his work each day. The member is a responsible and persevering person, and through this, the member is able to provide a better life for his family. The member is asking for the loan to buy wholesale wood. He is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments per the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood.

loans.name: Mbyja Koe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado  Mbyja Koe, está formado por 17  integrantes, están  en el 4° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza, con las capacitaciones y esfuerzo que van poniendo.
La Sra. Dominga, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo constante hoy día  diversificó  los productos  que vende  como comida,  frutas y verduras, esto con la ayuda de su  marido quien viaja para comprar las verduras en especial tomate y así se ayudan para poder sacar adelante la casa y la familia.
La Sra. Dominga  solicita este préstamo para la compra de  más productos como harina, azúcar, verduras, frutas, lácteos y demás, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The Mbyja Koe group is made up for 17 members.  They are in their fourth loan cycle with the women's committee program.  They are improving their condition of poverty with the training sessions and effort that they are putting forth.

Dominga, through effort and constant work, has diversified the products that she sells, including food, fruits, and vegetables.  She does this with the help of her husband, who travels to purchase the vegetables, especially the tomatoes.  This is how they help move their family forward.  

Dominga is requesting this loan to purchase more products, including flour, sugar, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and more.  This will help her create a stable plan for her business and improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia, 56 years old, lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with two children. Herminia is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, and planting vegetables and other agricultural commodities.

Finding herself in need of additional working capital, Herminia decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use it for buying farm inputs, including fertilizer, and for paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Herminia is very thankful, because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all or be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to have a decent home, someday.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, including fertilizer, and to pay labor costs for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia joined PMPC for her capital needs. She knew this would be her chance to expand her business, with enough capitalization. Virginia availed herself of another loan, to pay for flower pots and fertilizers.

Virginia perseveres and always believes she will reach her goal, to continuously provide for her family through her flower selling business.

loans.use: to pay for flower pots and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin building his home.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 48 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with two children. She sells rice grains in retail and sometimes in wholesale. She's been in this business for almost 30 years and earns a net income of PHP 20,000 weekly. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, Rosalia would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 30,000, to purchase rice grains to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Madame Mugoli, membre du groupe Mufariji est cliente de Hekima depuis plus de 3ans. A 30 ans d’âge, elle est mariée à un taximan et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle étale sa marchandise  de farine de manioc à son domicile situé sur une route nationale. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  3 bashes pour la conservation de sa marchandise.  Son objectif est de diversifier les activités une fois qu’elle aura touché ou réalisé des épargnes consistantes. Elle remercie Hekima pour les services financiers auprès des femmes sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Mrs. Mugoli, a member of the Mufariji group, has been a Hekima client for more than 3 years. At 30 years of age, she is married to a taxi driver and a mother of four, all of whom attend school. She lays out her merchandise of cassava flour at her home, which is located on a national route. She is seeking this loan to buy three tarps to conserve her merchandise. Her goal is to diversify her businesses as soon as she is able to consistently save. She thanks Hekima for their financial services to women without material collateral.

loans.use: to buy 3 tarps to conserve her merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years. She also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bags in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Rina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more bags to sell.

Rina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
After calculating and evaluating their last loan, the Awen Indah Group decided to propose a new loan to MUK. With 9 members and a 13,500,000 IDR loan, some members are still with the pig-raising program and other members will try a new effort as a farmer.
