They had success with their pig program and are able to continue to manage the business with their own money. This week the rain started to fall, and this is the right time to go to the garden and plant many crops.

Having had success with her own business selling piglets, Ni Komang is continuing to borrow and will now use her loan to purchase melon seeds and fertilizer. She has 10 acres of land, and together with her husband, she will grow melon fruit.

Ni Komang has calculated the cost: the melon program needs 4,000,000 IDR and she and her husband already have 2,500,000 IDR. The melon fruit needs 2.5 months from planting to harvest. Ni Komang predicts she can sell all of her melons and that she will receive 9,000,000 IDR with the melons priced at 6,000 IDR/kg. The profit will be around 5,000,000 IDR for 2.5 months.

She hopes that her plan will run smoothly and that the melon can grow well and without attack by diseases. And if she earns enough profit, she will not borrow a loan again but will give to other women in her village an opportunity to have a loan from MUK.

loans.use: to purchase melon seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace platos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Maria Elizabeth continues working in her business of food sales. Through this work she hopes to get ahead in life. The member prepares dishes such as oven-roasted chicken, soups, and more. Her dream is to expand her business of food sales. Maria Elizabeth is asking for the loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.

The member is pleased with the loan and promises to pay it back per the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA,la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de  compra y venta de chicha de jora y a la vez continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Fortunata is a part of the communal bank, "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa." She continues working in her business of the purchase and sale of corn beer and simultaneously raising small animals. The member is a responsible and persevering person, and wishes to be able to maintain this work to continue supporting her family. 

The member is asking for this loan to buy guinea pigs. She is grateful for the blessing of this loan and promises to repay it per the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens and plant trees

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is thankful for a previous 20,000 PHP loan she was granted which she used to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. She also has a tailoring business. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit and for some fabrics to prepare for Christmas orders. In small towns like Bacoor, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to  the market, church, to their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community.  

Her income from her businesses helps sustain her family's personal and household needs. She is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Milagros hopes to buy another tricycle unit and dreams of having her own place for her tailoring. She dreams that her children will have a bright future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, rice, spices, sardines and other groceries for her general store business.

Raquel has been in this business for five years. Raquel earns more income from vending vegetables.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, rice, spices, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Arlene is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 24 years old and married; she has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and school supplies.

Maricel has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell at her store. In the future Maricel would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Coney

texts.en:
Coney is 28 years old and married; she has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Coney has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock of rice to sell. Coney has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 36 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years she has raised and sold pigs in the Philippines.

Jeanne has taken out and successfully repaid three loans in the past through NWTF. She has now applied for a 12,000 loan to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs. She plans to use her profits on her pigs and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Emelieta

texts.en:
Emelieta is 51 years old and a widow with nine children. Two of her children are in school. 

Emelieta has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelieta has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell. Emelieta has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Emelieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Gina requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 29,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes that her hard work will help her to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and married with eight children. For the past thirty years she has worked hard drying and selling fish in the Philippines.

Gloria has applied for a 20,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use her profits to build her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. She is a teacher of 30 years old.  She is married and has two children. It is clear that Jenny works hard to maintain her family and at night after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improving their living conditions.
Jenny is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her  reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Sonia requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, She would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. He works in  the agriculture industry (beans, corn, and yucca). Age 34 years; he is married and has one child. It is clear that Denis works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his child will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions.
Denis is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus lives in a community in the Department of Yoro Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (beans, corn, and rice). Age 40 years; he is married and has five children. It is clear that Jesus works hard to maintain his family and at night after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions.
Jesus is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. Elizabeth is 48 years old from Molave - Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, and has been gifted with five children. Elizabeth is the breadwinner for the family and supports her family through farming activities.

In need of additional working capital, Elizabeth decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 20,000 for buying farm inputs and fertilizers and for paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Elizabeth is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a jeepney someday to use for service.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers to increase yield

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 27 years old. She is married and lives in Cantaroc, Siquijor, Philippines. Mary Jane found that she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. The co-op supported her in starting her sari-sari (small grocery) store. Then she wanted to expand her resources, so she decided to venture into the hog raising business.

Mary Jane has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for the proper and rapid growth of her hogs. This loan will give her hog raising income a big boost.

Mary Jane wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively so that she can provide a better living and a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for the proper and rapid growth of her hogs

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en:
Tranquilina is a resident of Mahayag. She cultivates her rice land to support her family. She learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it offers. She has tried her luck in borrowing an amount to pay for her farming activities. 

Tranquilina has taken the loan amount to pay for the labor costs associated in selling her harvest. This will help in giving her farming income a big boost. Tranquilina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios busies herself on her farmland in Mahayag. She cultivates and produces rice and corn to earn a living. She joined PMPC for her needed capitalization. 

She has availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to buy a second-hand thresher to increase productivity of the tedious farm labor and for continued income.  

Remedios perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand thresher

loans.name: Mitzi

texts.en:
Mitzi is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.

Mitzi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mitzi has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a manicure business.

Mitzi aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wenina

texts.en:
Wenina is 63 years old. She is married and has nine children. One of her children is in school.

Wenina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Wenina has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 19 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Wenina would like to save enough money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Lee

texts.en:
Ana Lee is 43 years old. She is widowed and she has two children. Ana Lee works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Lee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana Lee has been in this business for 18 years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ana Lee would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 59 years old and married with six children. Nonita works very hard to provide for them.

Nonita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nonita has been in this business for fourteen years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Nonita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. He requested another loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which he will use to buy more fish to sell to his customers. This loan will help to further build his business and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gleceria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gleceria has been farming sugarcane for 10 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is a farmer (coffee and cacao), age 49 years; he is married and has three children. It is clear that Mario works hard to maintain his family and at night after a hard day of work the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to do their homework and improve the living conditions. 
Mario is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit him to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a home solar system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan, 32, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Gina, a food attendant, and they have two kids. The eldest child is still in the Preparatory Level and the youngest is not of school age yet. Jonathan's wife manages their household while he attends to his business. He works hard to augment their income to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Jonathan has a backyard piggery farm and has been a hog raiser for five years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business as female pigs conceive twice in a year and can produce as much as 12 piglets each time.

To help him continue operations of his business, Jonathan is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which he will use to buy more feeds and clean grain for his pigs. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Jonathan aims to grow his business. He wants to give his children the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and rice for his piggery farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
From Dumingag, Elizabeth labors for her farming activities. She has sought help from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and the financial assistance it offers. 

Elizabeth tried to borrow a loan to pay for seedlings and compost to have good quality rice. This will give her farming income a big boost. 

Elizabeth looks for better business opportunities, and would like to purchase a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old, married and resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter. They have five children, of which two are in college.  

Starting with capitalization of 2,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari store (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April, 2011 and has taken out several loans. 

Now, she is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities to increase her inventory and generate more income.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities to increase her inventory and generate more income.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old and married with one child. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, sugar, and school supplies. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jen Jen

texts.en:
Jen Jen is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jen Jen has a general store in the Philippines. Jen Jen requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Jen Jen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jen Jen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 31 years old and married with one child in school.

Yvonne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell to customers.

Yvonne has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Yvonne aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Letecia is a vendor of fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell .

loans.name: Sheila Mei

texts.en:
Sheila Mei is 28 years old. She is married and has one child in school. Sheila Mei works very hard to provide for the family.

Sheila Mei runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Sheila Mei would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva lives in Same and she is a businesswoman. She got involved in business activities a few year ago; she started with her own working capital. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 because she has a kiosk and she also is selling clothes. She is very interested with her business, so she took a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She wants used to buy more goods such as a knife, a scoop, sewing thread, umbrellas and other things to sell, including clothes. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy additional supplies. 

She needed to taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to improve her management of her business, and she wants to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy a knife, a scoop, sewing thread, umbrellas and other things to sell, including clothes.

loans.name: Ekaterina

texts.ru:
Екатерина замужем. У нее двое сыновей: 11 и 15 лет. Екатерина работает на шахте. Она трудолюбивый, предприимчивый и доброжелательный человек. Екатерина довольна своей жизнью, но стремиться к лучшему.

Екатерина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10 000 гривен на покупку новой мебели. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия ее семьи.
texts.en: Ekaterina is married and has two sons, ages 11 and 15. She works at the mine and is a hardworking, entrepreneurial, friendly person. She is happy with her life and tries to make the best of things. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy new furniture, which will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture

loans.name: San Hilarion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Curahuasi, perteneciente a la provincia de Abancay y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “San Hilarion” communal bank, located in the Curahuasi district, Abancay province, Cusco department.  The member, Bertha, is 43 years old, single, and has two children.  She works in her business selling corn, wheat, and quinoa cereal.  She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm, and she has been in this business for four years.  It is going very well, and her dream is to have a location where she can sell her cereals.  She is requesting the loan to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa. 

Unfortunately, the members added to the group picture did not attend the day of the picture due to work reasons. 

The other members are engaged in businesses selling animals, cereal, groceries, and food.  Bertha is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this means, and promise to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
In the year 2012, Liezel learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it extends to its Microfinance Members. As a farmer in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, she grows variety of commodities but has found good income in rice farming. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Liezel wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is married and earns a living by raising pigs and fishing in the Philippines. She has taken out and successfully repaid five previous loans through NWTF to help support her work.

Janice is now borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that her hard work will help her to build her business and so secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Ines

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de  20, 18 y 15 años, ella estudio hasta el sexto grado, su esposo por la falta de empleo en el país emigro a otro país, no obstante le ayuda a cubrir con ciertas necesidades en el hogar, María aun contando con el apoyo de su esposo tomo la decisión de comercializar con lácteos y al saber administrar sus ventas vio que era rentable; su producto lo compra en la zona norte de a 50 kilómetros de su comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar queso, crema, guajada, requeson, quesillo al mayoreo. Para obtener mejores precios y a la vez un margen de ganancias mayor.

 María y sus hijos viven en una propiedad de un familiar y su sueño es que con la ayuda de Credicampo poder llegar a obtener su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, is married and has three children ages 20, 18, and 15.  She has a sixth grade education, and her husband emigrated to another country due to lack of employment in their country.  However, he helps her pay for certain household needs.  Even with her husband’s support, Maria decided to sell dairy products and, knowing how to manage her sales, she saw that it was profitable.  She buys her products in the northern area, fifty kilometers from her community.

She is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale cheese, cream, cottage cheese, “requesón” [a Hispanic version of ricotta cheese], and “quesillo” [a soft cheese of Central America] to obtain better prices while earning a higher profit margin.  Maria and her children live in a family member’s property, and her dream is that she will able to buy her own home with Credicampo’s help.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cheese, cream, cottage cheese, “requesón” [a Hispanic version of ricotta cheese], and “quesillo” [a soft cheese of Central America].

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима, 47 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Салимы средне-специальное образование, с  1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Салима смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть 2 коровы, 1 нетель и 30 овец. Также есть 2,92 ГА земли, где Салима выращивает картофель для реализации. Супруг и сын активно и с удовольствием помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль Салимы составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец и 1 коровы для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салима планирует направить на расширение ее бизнеса, также на обучение ее сына - студента.
texts.en: Salima is 47, married, and has a son. She has a vocational education and has been raising livestock and planting crops since 1995. She has been able to develop her business and currently has two cows, a calf, and 30 sheep, along with 2.92 hectares of land where she plants potatoes to sell. Her spouse and son actively and happily help her on the farm. Salima earns about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her business Salima applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank in order to buy 20 sheep and a cow to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and a cow to expand her business

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 36 years old and she lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with one child. 

Judelyn is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious person finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and a variety of other agricultural activities. 

In need of additional working capital, Judelyn decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already. She recently requested a 10,000 PHP loan for buying farm inputs and fertilizers and paying labor costs for cultivating her land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Judelyn is very thankful, because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to have a motorcycle someday for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is 56 years old and has three children, two of whom attend school. He is from Tudela, Philippines. From his desire to provide for his family, he engaged in balut vending business. Balut is a  fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines. He used his motorcycle to reach the different villages and sell balut. 

In need of additional working capital, Eleazar requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase more stocks of balut to sell to serve more customers. He joined Paglaum MPC in 2012 and appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. With the loan, he hopes to increase his more income and provide for the daily needs of his family. He is also happy that he can support the education of his children, which is his main priority. Eleazar wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of balut to sell

loans.name: Santos David

texts.es:
Santos David tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes; vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse; en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general, etc. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Santos David se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con un terreno agrícola propio el cual esta ubicado en el sector de cabuyas el cual esta ubicado a unos 15 minutos de la Urb Pucara, en dichos terrenos cuenta con fincas de cacao y frutales como lima, naranja y otras frutas. Santos David cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro por más de 10 años, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, solvencia moral y económica. Santos David necesita del crédito para poder invertir en abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo, pues invirtiendo en su negocio él podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos David is 55 years old, married, and has two children who depend on him. He lives with his spouse and their two children in the district of Pucará, a medium-sized district with aspirations to improve. In said district the population works in agriculture, the cultivation of rice being the most produced, as well as general business, etc. Said district is located in the province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.

Santos David works in agriculture. He has his own agricultural land that is located in the area of Cabuyas, which is located 15 minutes from Pucará. On these lands he has farms of cacao and fruit like lime, orange, and other fruits. Santos David has a lot of experience in the field, over ten years. He has very good personal and work references, and economic and moral solvency. Santos David needs a loan to be able to invest in manure and fertilizer for his crop, since by investing in his business he will be able to acquire an acceptable income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in manure and fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia tiene 59 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el caserío Linderos del Ala. La vida en el caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Otilia es la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora, comida y crianza de animales(patos, cuyes, entre otros). La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años, en el caserío Linderos del Ala. Otilia cuenta con terreno agrícola de sembrio de platano que lo obtuvo como herencia de sus padres. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de plantas de platano, las cuales serán plantadas en su terreno agricola, pues desea invertir en este rubro porque el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Otilia piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio en base a un buen producto , e incrementando sus ventas para poder mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Otilia is 59 years old, and she lives in her own house together with her spouse in the little village of Linderos del Ala. They have 4 adult children. Life in the village is tranquil, and most inhabitants work in agriculture, livestock and raising animals. This village is located in the Buenos Aires district, in the Morropón province in the Piura region on the North coast of Peru.

Otilia sells beer, chicha, and food, and she raises animals (ducks, guinea pigs, among others). She has been working in this for more than three years in the village of Linderos del Ala. Otilia has agriculture land fit for growing bananas that she got as inheritance from her parents. The loan will go towards buying banana plants, which will be planted on her land. She wants to invest in this area because the market has good prospects given that this product is very marketable in the area. 

Otilia thinks of working by offering good service based on good products, and improving her sales to be able to improve her income, grow her earnings, and in the end improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy banana plants.

loans.name: Jerriel

texts.en:
Jerriel, 22, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He has a partner named Joan, a tricycle driver, and a kid who is in the Preparatory Level in school. They both work to continually provide income to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Jerriel operates a variety store while his partner drives their side car. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails fresh, dried, and packaged goods. It has almost all the essential household items and food. He earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. 

To help him grow his business, he is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn rice, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, and beverages; and to pay for his sidecar which his partner will drive around their community. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. In the photo, his partner appears standing beside their sidecar while he is with their child inside the unit.

Jerriel aims to grow his business to give his family a better life. He wants to give his child the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items and a sidecar for his business

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.en:
Reinalda is 57 years old and married with six children. For the past five years she has owned an internet café in the Philippines.

Reinalda has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her business. She plans to invest more in her internet café and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her internet café.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 59 years old, widowed, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Felomina requested her sixth loan from NTWT for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gulfairus

texts.ru: Гулфайрус 61 год, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные, она помогает им с воспитанием внуков. Товаровед по средне-специальному образованию, Гулфайрус много лет проработала продавцом в магазине. На протяжении последних 15 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулфайрус, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство. В наличии есть 1,36 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель и эспарцет, также есть 1 корова, 1 бычок и 5 овец. Всю прибыль Гулфайрус старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса или воспитание внуков. В этом году Гулфайрус решила провести в дом водопровод и установить систему отопления. Поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку печи, труб и прочих строительных материалов. Доходы от ведения бизнеса она будет вкладывать в развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulfairus is 61, married, and has three grown children. She helps raise her grandchildren. She is a saleswoman with a secondary education and worked in a shop for many years. For the past 15 years she has been planting crops and raising livestock. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a well-developed farm with 1.36 hectares of irrigated land for planting potatoes and hay. She also has a cow, a young bull, and five sheep. She tries to use her profits to continue investing in her business and to raise her grandchildren. This year she decided install plumbing and heating in the house. This is why she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a furnace, pipes, and other building materials. She will use the profits from her business to continue investing in her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a furnace, pipes, and construction materials in order to install heating and plumbing in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three sewing machines, a generator, and sewing materials

loans.name: Ngone's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres entretiennent une très bonne cohésion sociale à cause du lien de parenté existant. Les membres s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
Ndeye, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est mariée et âgée de 42 ans. Elle fait comme activité principale le commerce de pâte d'arachide, de pochettes, d'huile de palme, de café. En parallèle, elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires et aussi dans sa localité.
Elle achète 50 Kg de pâte d'arachide à 500 F le Kg; 40 pochettes à 600 F l'une; 60 litres d'huile de palme à 1000 F le litre et le sac de café à 15500 F. Elle achète le mouton à 45000 F. Elle revend le Kg de pâte d'arachide à 1000 F, les pochettes à 750 F l'une, l'huile de palme à 1300 F le litre, le café à 50 F le gobelet et le mouton à 75000 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce ses épargnes, paie ses intérêts, améliore les conditions de vie de sa famille (elle a carrelé sa chambre et acheté une armoire) et aide ses enfants dans leurs besoins.
texts.en:
This 6-member group is a part of the "banc villageois" which was created June 4, 2011. It is made up of members who live in the same village and surrounding area. The members have a solid social connection due to existing family ties.

The members of the group are mostly in the business of raising livestock. Ndeye, standing on the right in the photo and with her hand raised, is married and 42 years old. She is in the main business of selling groundnut butter, wallets, palm oil, and coffee. At the same time, Ndeye raises sheep.

Ndeye stocks up in the outdoor markets and also in her neighborhood. She will purchase 50kg of groundnut butter at 500 francs CFA per kg, 40 wallets at 600 francs CFA each, 60 liters of palm oil at 1000 francs CFA per liter, and a bag of coffee at 15,500 francs CFA. She will purchase a lamb for 45,000 francs CFA. 

Ndeye resells each kilogram of groundnut butter at 1000 francs CFA, the wallets at 750 francs CFA each, the palm oil at 1300 francs CFA per liter, the coffee at 50 francs CFA per cup, and the sheep at 75,000 francs CFA. 

With her profits, Ndeye will increase her savings, pay her loan interest, improve the living conditions for her family (she tiled her bedroom and purchased a dresser) and help her children with their needs.

loans.use: to go into business and raise sheep

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. In addition to doing her hobby, she also earns an income as well. At the age of 61 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with her capital that supports her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers to produce beautiful flowers to sell. 

In the future, Alita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio Hugo se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate Hugo continues working in the transport business. The associate runs a taxi service and works from 7 am until 7 pm. His dream is to buy a new car. The associate asks for hte loan to buy tires for his car. 

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to meet all the payments of his fees.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito owns and cultivates his rice land in Mahayag. This is how he supported his family. He learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it offers. He tried to borrow a loan for his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. Carlito borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give his farming income a big boost.  Carlito looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr: Maman Nabintu  est secrétaire de l’association d’affaire Tupendane. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 40ans, mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un  chômeur. Le prêt sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 4 cartons de savon, 3 bidons d’huile d’arachide, 3 sacs de sucre, 100kg de riz et 2  cartons de pile. Elle envisage diversifier d’autres activités dans le but d’agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie Hekima du fait que même les frères, les amis ne peuvent l’emprunter l'argent mais Hekima appuie les femmes rurales sans trop de conditions et renforce leur capacité de vivre avec les autres pour des objectifs communs.
texts.en:
Mother Nabintu is the secretary of the Tupendane business group. A dynamic woman, she is the 40-year-old mother of 6 children who have all received formal schooling. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

She is seeking a loan to buy four cartons of soap, three jugs of groundnut oil, three bags of sugar, 100 kg of rice, and two cartons of batteries. 
She is planning to diversify and include new activities in order to expand her business. 

Since even her brothers and friends are unable to lend her the funds, she is thankful that Hekima is there to support women from rural communities without imposing stringent conditions, as this helps to bolster their ability to all live together and pursue common goals.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of soap, three jugs of groundnut oil, three bags of sugar, 100 kg of rice, and two cartons of batteries.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when went broke after her first business went bad. 

PMPC came to Tessie's rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation to sustain her business for the family. Tessie perseveres and always believes so she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella y su familia viven en la Comunidad Corpaputo en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, el domicilio tiene luz y agua, la vivienda es un poco precaria Herminia es productora de quesos y comerciante, Herminia realiza viajes largos a la ciudad de El Alto llevando sus productos y quiere un credito para producir mayor cantidad de queso Herminia es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y tiene buena voluntad, por eso esperamos que la ayuden puesto que entre sus expectativas esta mejorar su vivienda en un futuro que no sea lejano, según ella
texts.en: Herminia is single but she has one child. She and her family live in the Corpaputo community in an adobe house, which belongs to her. The home has light and water; the house is a little precarious. Herminia is a cheese maker and business woman. She takes long trips to the city of El Alto carrying her products, and she wants a loan to produce better quality cheese. She is the only source of food in her home, but she enjoys good health and good will. For this reason we hope that you will help her since among her hopes is to improve her home in the not too distant future, according to her.

loans.use: to produce better quality cheese

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia Agripina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de complementos alimenticios, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar complementos alimenticios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate Agripina works in the sale of food supplements. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. She has 4 years experience in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the business of selling natural products. The associate asks for the loan to buy food supplements. 

She is happy for the loan and promises to complete the payments of her fees.

loans.use: to buy food supplements

loans.name: Zenie

texts.en:
Zenie is 45 years old, married, and a resident of Del Pilar, Baliangao, Philippines.  Her husband is a manual laborer. They are blessed with four children. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  

She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 3,000PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successful, she was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, of which she became a member in June, 2009. She was able to avail herself of two loans, and paid them religiously. 

Now she applies for a loan of 5,000PHP to finance additional stock for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to finance additional stock for her store

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Paulita came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. 

Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to purchase inputs and fertilizer for a better harvest.  

Paulita perseveres, and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta, 65 years old, is married and a resident of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk to sell at the market.

Enriqueta and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because they wanted to buy a variety of fish to sell. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits, like insurance and savings.  

She has now applied for a loan to buy her fish to sell. 

She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she will be a successful vendor someday, and will own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte, 29 years old, lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with two children. 

Her husband is a tricycle driver. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious person finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and a variety of other agricultural activities. 

In need of additional working capital, Charlotte decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 16,000 PHP to pay for labor costs for cultivating her land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Charlotte is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. 

She hopes to own another motorcycle for transportation someday.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and trisikad transportation. Anita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is a 37-year-old homemaker who works very hard to care for her young family, which includes her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). She lives with her family in Anandanagar, a village in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. Her children are students in grades 12, 5 and 5.

Mala’s husband is associated with a firewood business. Mala also supports her husband’s small-scale business, selling firewood. Her husband, 49-year-old Ajit, buys firewood from the wholesalers and retails it to the villagers. Firewood is widely used in the rural region for cooking.  

The income that comes in from the business is stretched to cover their living needs, and Mala diligently saves some money from the income. This needy but honest family aspires to a better living standard and the guarantee of education for their children. To that end, they need to start earning and saving better. 

So, Mala is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to boost the inventory of their firewood business. The loan will help this hardworking couple take a key step in achieving their goals of financial stability and independence and education for their children.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian  de 49 años de edad  vive en Sololá, casado con  tres hijos el 1 primer hijo ya es casado y los 2 últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. El se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de Sebastian pues es la actividad que el realiza y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de  fertilizantes químicos y orgánico ya que para el es de importancia que sus cultivos sean las mejores por la región para tener mejores ingresos económicos.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos y brindarles educación para que ellos lleguen a ser personas de éxito en la vida.
texts.en:
Sebastian, 49, lives in Sololá.  He is married with three children; the first is already married and the last two are students at their community’s school.  He has been engaged in working the land as a farmer for many years, and it is the only job that generates income to support his family and provide them with suitable living conditions.

The land has been blessed by Sebastian’s hands because it is the activity that he does, and he enjoys working and caring for it.  It is a job worthy of admiration, one that men engage themselves in for many years and for their entire lives.  Without the labor of the male farmers that cultivate the land, it would not bear fruit to sustain a whole generation.

The reason for requesting his loan is to purchase chemical and organic fertilizers because it is important for him that his crops be the best in the region so that he has better income.  His goals are to pay off his debts with what he has and, in the future, buy more land for his children and provide them with an education so that they become successful people in life

loans.use: to purchase chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Rhulangane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nabalume est  conseillère  du groupe  Rhulangane. Agée de  48 ans, elle est  mariée  à un agent de l’Etat Congolais et  mère de 10 enfants dont seulement 8 étudient et 2 n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge d’aller à l’école. Elle sollicite ce credit  pour acheter  25kg de haricot. Son ambition est d’avoir son propre emplacement en terme de dépôt pour être bien identifié dans son activité.Elle prie Dieu de bénir Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes pauvres économiquement actives et pour son esprit entrepreneurial cultivé.
texts.en:
Nabalume is Rhulangane Group's adviser. She is 48 years old, married to a Congolese state official, and the mother of 10 children, only eight of whom attend school and two of whom are not yet old enough to go to school.

Nabalume is seeking this loan in order to purchase 25kg of beans. Her goal is to have her own place [to use] as a warehouse so that she can be well-known in her business. She prays that God will bless Hekima for its support of economically active poor women and for nurturing her entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: To purchase 25kg of beans.

loans.name: Cellestine

texts.en:
Cellestine is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Cellestine operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the loan requested, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access the loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes

loans.name: Menaka

texts.en:
Menaka is a 45-year-old widow who hails from Maynaguri. She lost her husband a few years back. After her husband's death, she had to take the full responsibility for her only son. Due to poverty, she could not provide education to him. Now he is working as a mason. Menaka lives with her son at Upenpally in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Menaka and her husband used to rear cows and sell milk in the village. After her husband’s death, Menaka herself manages the business. Sometimes her son helps her. She has two dairy cows, and she delivers milk to the villagers. Now she wants to increase her savings; thus, she desires to grow her business.

So, Maneka has decided to buy a new cow for her dairy business. She seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to make this purchase. The extra milk from the cow will increase their monthly income, a small but strong beginning in achieving their goal of increased savings. The loan will help this family to take them to stability for a better future.

She dreams of making a cattle herd in the future, and she thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for rearing cattle and selling milk.

loans.name: Nour Eddin

texts.en:
Nour Eddin is a 25-year-old, single man from a village near Jenin City. His family has a big business which is a barn for raising sheep. All the family members cooperate together in the work. They produce milk and other dairy products and also sell meat to the local shops. It is a good business, but it needs some improvements.

Nour Eddin took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more sheep for the family barn. By taking this loan, Nour Eddin will be able to improve the family business and expand it. 

Nour Eddin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the family barn.

loans.name: Ezz Eddin

texts.en:
Ezz Eddin is a 23-year-old single young man from Deir Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a small house. His father is a worker at a local firm, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Ezz is a student in a local university, where he studies business administration. He would like to complete his study and find a job to support his family. 

Ezz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Ezz will be able to write his reports and read articles online. 

Ezz appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oils, sardines, soy sauce, ketchup, balm, coffee, noodles, candles, perfumes, biscuits, medicine, soaps, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana es madre soltera de un hijo. Adriana vive con su madre en La Paz en una casa donde se paga un anticrético que está a nombre de la madre de Adriana Si bien la casa es de ladrillo y cemento, el domicilio posee luz, agua y alcantarillado. Adriana se gana la vida como funcionaria publica pero su futuro es incierto pues dentro de tres meses habrá elecciones por lo que su puesto podria estar en riesgo ES por eso que Adriana esta tomando precauciones y quiere un credito para pagar estudios superiores en Comunicacion Adriana es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y quiere superarse, ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Adriana is a single mom and has one son.  She lives with her mother in La Paz in a house where a fixed sum payment is given to rent the house, which is in the name of her mother.  The house is made of brick and mortar, and the home has light, water and sewer paid.  Adriana earns her living as a public official but her future is uncertain.   Within three months, there will be elections and her position could be at risk.  Because of this, Adriana is taking precautions and would like a loan to pay her higher education in Communications.  Adriana is earning the only source of income in her home, she is in good health and wants to overcome her challenges.  She needs your help.

loans.use: to pay higher education expenses in Communications.

loans.name: Latefih

texts.en:
Latefih is a 33-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She lives with her husband and four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income due to the demand. 

Latefih decided to complete her study and find a job in the future to help her husband in part of the family expenses. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Latefih will be able to complete her study faster and improve herself. 

Latefih appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Zulma Haydee

texts.es:
Zulma aparece en la fotografia junto a sus hijos.

Zulma de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado no pudo continuar con sus estudios al formar un hogar muy joven de cual tiene dos hijos de seis años y un bebe de año y medio; su hijo mayor esta en primer grado, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura tanto él como Zulma son personas muy trabajadoras, por lo cual al no encontrar un empleo formal Zulma combina su trabajo de ama de casa con el de comerciante informal, por las mañanas vende atol de maíz el cual ella misma prepara desde horas muy tempranas y por las tardes vende tamales de gallina, recorre aproximadamente un kilómetro ofreciendo tamales y atol, ella es consiente que debe de ayudar económicamente en el hogar; por lo cual ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para ayudar a su esposo a la compra de insumos agrícolas para la cosecha de maíz la idea es poder cosechar el maíz suficiente para el consumo familiar y parte venderlo y a la vez fortalecer un poco más sus ventas.

Especificamente comprara semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. El sueño de Zulma es instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa y con los ingresos brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar y prepararse para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Zulma appears in the photograph together with her children. 

Zulma is 27 years old. She studied until the 7th grade; she couldn't continue with her studies because she formed a home very young in which she has two children, a six year old and a one and a half year old baby.

Her oldest child is in first grade. Her husband works in agriculture. Both she and her husband are very hardworking people, which is why when she couldn't find a formal job, Zulma combined her work as a housewife with that of informal businesswoman. In the mornings she sells corn atole, which she herself makes in the early hours, and in the afternoons she sells chicken tamales. She goes over approximately a kilometer offering tamales and atole. 

She is conscious that she should help out economically in the home. That is why she has decided to ask for a loan to help her husband to purchase agricultural goods for the corn harvest. The idea is to be able to harvest enough corn for the family's consumption and to sell it, and at the same time strengthen her sales a little. 

Specifically, she would buy corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides. Zulma's dream is to install a small store in her house and with the income provide her children the opportunity to study and prepare themselves so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Nieves Azucena

texts.es:
Nieves es una joven muy entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando en un Instituto de su ciudad una carrera técnica, ella está saliendo adelante gracias al buen ejemplo que le han brindado sus padres y a todos los valores con los que fue inculcada desde niña. Para apoyar a su familia en los gastos de estudio y en los gastos del hogar está trabajando en una gran empresa como cajera, es una hija muy responsable y siempre ayuda a su familia.
Nieves quiere trasladarse a otro Instituto y así poder convalidar los cursos que ya ha estudiado hasta el momento, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para hacer su traslado al otro Instituto y pagar la matrícula y compra de materiales. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su desempeño mejorará y más adelante podrá convertirse en una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Nieves is a very enthusiastic young woman with a great desire to achieve. She is single and lives in Ica with her family.

She is now studying at an institution in her city in a technical program. She is getting ahead thanks to the good example that her parents have offered her and to all the values with which she was instilled she was a little girl. To help her family with the educational and household expenses, she is working for a large business as a cashier. She is a very responsible daughter and always helps her family.

Nieves wants to transfer to another institution and thus be able to validate the classes that she has taken up to now. It is for that reason that she is thinking of using the loan to make her transfer to the other institution and pay her registration fees and buy materials. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. She wants them to know that with this, her performance will improve, and in the future she will be able to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to transfer her studies to another institution, pay for registration, and buy materials.

loans.name: Nelson Alberto

texts.es:
Recoger el pasto todos los días para seguir engordando a sus terneros es el trabajo de Nelson quien ha logrado mantener a su ganado e incrementar sus ganancias por la calidad de sus animales, con la  ayuda de su padre y el crédito anterior ha logrado mantener su negocio. Nelson se ha caracterizado por ser responsable, trabajador, entusiasta, y ahora quiere seguir expandiendo su negocio para obtener las mejores ganancias y de esa manera ayudar a su familia. Agradece el financiamiento del crédito anterior ya que ha sido responsable con el pago.
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando, Nelson solicita otro crédito para pagar el alquiler del potrero donde tiene el ganado y comprar otro ternero ya que quiere dejar que el pasto donde se encuentran los animales se recupere en este tiempo de invierno y de esa manera poder obtener buenos resultados en el verano, este le servirá para la alimentación de su ganado. Este crédito es de mucha importancia para Nelson y deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para lograr lo propuesto y así mantener a su ganado.
texts.en:
Gathering grass every day to continue raising his calves is Nelson´s work. He has successfully managed to maintain his cattle and increase his earnings due to the quality of his animals. With the help of his father and a previous loan, he managed to maintain his business. Nelson has described himself to be responsible, hard working, and enthusiastic, and now he wants to continue expanding his business to obtain better earnings and ultimately help his family. 

He is grateful for the funding from the previous loan, and he was responsible with his repayments. 

With a desire to continue prospering, Nelson is asking for another loan to pay the pasture's rent, where he has his cattle, and to buy another calf. Since he would like to allow the fields where he feeds his cattle to recuperate over the winter, he expects to have better outcomes in the summer. This will help him feed his cattle. This loan is of great importance to Nelson, and he is placing his trust in this funding to achieve his objective and take care of his animals.

loans.use: to pay the pasture's rent, where he has his cattle, and to buy another calf.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Meila: Es una mujer amable, trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 35 años de edad, casada. Tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo es marinero. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 6 años vende ropa usada. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles: pacas mixtas y paca para niños. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa nueva. En la fotografia se ubica en medio de las otras dos integrantes.
texts.en:
Meila,35, is a friendly and hardworking woman from Puerto Cabezas.  She's married and has four school-aged children.  Her husband's a sailor.

She has sold used clothing for six years to have her own source of income and improve her family's quality of life.

She's requesting financing to buy merchandise in Managua to sell at affordable prices: a bale of children's clothing and bales of mixed clothing.

Her dream is to have a store to sell new clothing. In the photograph Meila is located in between the two other girls.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, no tiene hijos bajo su responsabilidad, Mercedes dedicado al servicio de transporte por más de 3 años, vive en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Mercedes se dedica al servicio de transporte via terrestre, desde hace más de 3 años. Su ruta es Pucara – Pandachi y viciversa. Mercedes necesita del crédito para realizar la compra de llantas, filtros, entre otros, y para el servicio de mantenimento a su movilidad, asi mejorar los servicios que brinda. Asegurando de esta forma el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajao para poder seguir generando sus ingresos propios.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 59 years old, lives with her spouse, and does not have any children in her care. She lives in the Pucará district in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountain range of Perú. Her community basically works in agriculture, ranching, and in commerce. 

Mercedes has worked in ground transportation for more than three years. Her route is between Pucara and Pandachi and vice versa. Mercedes is in need of this loan to purchase tires and filters, among other supplies, to service and maintain her vehicle. Assuring that her equipment functions correctly for her work will help her improve the services she provides and allow her to continue generating her own income.

loans.use: to buy tires and filters, among other supplies, to service and maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Berlinda

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 36 años. 

Desde joven ha trabajado en la actividad comercial, inició laborando con un familiar en una distribuidora, luego montó una salsamentaria, pero por cuestiones de salud, tuvo que cerrarlo; en el año 2011 comenzó a vender mercancía, ropa, calzado, accesorios y productos por catálogo, con esta actividad tiene la oportunidad de estar al frente de su hogar y cuidar de su familia. 

Es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, por eso solicita el crédito con la Corporación, el cual desea invertir en la compra de mercancía y productos al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas. 

Ana sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, convertirlo en un almacén, que le genere mayores ingresos para brindar una mejor calodad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old, married, and mother to a 36 year old son. From a young age she has worked in the business field. She started with a family member as a distributor, then opened a deli, but because of health issues she had to close it. In 2011 she began selling merchandise, clothing, shoes and accessories by catalog, something she could do from home and still take care of her family. She is a hard-working woman with the desire to succeed, so she is seeking a loan from the Corporation to invest in buying merchandise and products at wholesale (clothing, accessories, perfume, cosmetics, and other items) with the goal of taking advantage of the discounts and be able to have more products to offer her customers and improve sales.
