Ana dreams of growing her business, converting it into a store, that it generates more income to improve the quality of life of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en este una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Bacilio se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que esta ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para la compra de una cantidad mayor y variedad de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar su inventario de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Bacilio piensa mejorar productividad y diversidad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitira en corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 50 years old. He is married, has one son, and lives with his family in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. His community works mainly in farming, livestock production, and commerce.

Bacilio earns his living raising and selling animals. With more than ten years experience in the business, which is located in his house, he is requesting the loan to purchase a larger quantity and variety of animals. This investment will help him to increase his inventory of animals, which will greatly affect his business. 

Bacilio is planning to improve the productivity and diversity of the animals so that he can meet the varying needs and tastes of his customers in the area. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, increase his profits, and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity and variety of animals. This investment will help to increase his inventory of animals.

loans.name: Segar Sejati Group

texts.en:
The Segar Sejati group is a new group consisting of eight members. They are all farmers with land. With their husbands, they plant many kinds of crops such as peanuts, chilis, corn, and rice. The group has requested a loan of 20,000,000 IDR to purchase seeds and fertilizer, to rent a tractor, and to pay maintenance costs (an employee).

The Segar Sejati group is headed by Ni Luh. She is 53 years old and has two adult children. Both of her children are already married and live with their families. Her husband is also a farmer. Ni Luh will use her portion of the loan to purchase rice seed and fertilizer, and to rent a tractor. She will plant rice in her paddy. Ni Luh hopes the weather will support her planting and that she can have a good harvest.

Ni Luh spends 30,000 IDR daily for food and 300,000 IDR monthly for electricity.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer, and to rent a tractor

loans.name: Josselyn Andreina

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Judas Tadeo.
En este lugar vive la señorita Josselyn, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y estudia el séptimo semestre en Administración de empresas. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda  que le brindan para salir adelante.
Doña Josselyn es una joven muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante, ella en sociedad con su mamá tienen un negocio de comida, ellas preparan almuerzos todos los días y los fines de semana además de almuerzos también venden encebollados, plato preferido por sus clientes que a diario visitan su local, ya son tres años que tienen este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo que le sirva para sacar adelante sus estudios y también colaborar con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pescado, carne, arroz, verduras, aceite y otros víveres para la elaboración de sus platos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and enchanting landscapes, we find the place where the San Judas Tadeo Credit Group meets every fifteen days. 

This is where Josselyn lives; she is 22 years old, single, and is in her seventh semester of business administration studies.  She lives in her parents' home.  She has been with the credit group for two years and she likes  because of the help it offers her to get ahead.

Josselyn is a very hardworking young woman who likes to work so she can get ahead.  Together with her mother, she has a business of selling prepared food; they prepare lunches every day and on weekends in addition to lunches they sell sautéed onions, which is a favorite dish of the customers who visit their establishment daily.  They have had this business for three years now and it allows her to earn something to help her get ahead with her studies and also to contribute toward the household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy food supplies to make their prepared foods.  Her dreams are to have a big restaurant and to complete her higher education studies.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, rice, vegetables,oil, and other.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma has accepted various jobs to earn a living. She does laundry and busies herself through dry goods selling. She always dreamed of opening a Ready To Wear (RTW) store to support her two children. She will use her loan to buy RTW material. Lerma is saving her profits and wants to maintain a good repayment record with the cooperative. Lerma has had her laundry area floored with concrete using her profits. In the future, she dreams of owning a larger space for her business.

loans.use: To buy Ready To Wear material for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Alyssa Jen

texts.en: Alyssa Jen is a 20-year-old student from Baggao, Cagayan. She is supporting herself by selling Avon products. But her earnings are not enough, so she wants to avail herself of an education loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to sustain her schooling while taking up a BS degree in Information Technology. She wants to finish college to help her parents and be able to return the favor of their hardships.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Cinthia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cinthia del Socorro tiene 29 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 1 hija, vive en casa propia en el caserío la Bocana distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el caserio se desarrolla tranquilamente, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Cinthia del Socorro es la crianza y comercio de animales menores(patos, cuyes, gallinas, entre otros). La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años, en su caserío. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio(compra de animales como pavos, pollo, cerdos, etc.). El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Cinthia del Socorro piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio a sus clientes e incrementando sus ventas. Lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cinthia del Socorro is 29 years old, married, and the mother of a daughter. She and her family live in their own home in the village of La Bocana in La Matanza District. This area is part of the Piura Region along Peru's northern coast. Life in La Bocana is peaceful, and people here make a living as farmers, ranching, and animal husbandry.  

Cinthia del Socorro has for over three years raised and sold turkeys, guinea pigs, hens, and other small animals in La Bocana. She will use the funds from this loan to invest in her business by purchasing turkeys, chickens, pigs, and other animals. The market for these animals is promising as there is demand  in the region. Cinthia del Socorro plans to provide high-quality service to her customers and boost her sales. Higher sales will in the short-term allow her to earn higher income in the short-term, boost her earnings, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, such as turkeys, chickens, pigs, and other animals.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 46-year-old mother of four from Baggao, Cagayan. She and her husband earn a living through farming. Sometimes their earnings are not enough to send their children to school. That’s why Eugenia wants to avail herself of an education loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use this loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee. Her daughter, Jova Mae, is taking up BS Business Administration. She hopes that this course will help her be a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to her home.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario, 53, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a pastor. They have three children, two of whom are in college and the other one is already working. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Rosario has a direct selling business. She sells natural, organic health products. Filipinos nowadays are more health conscious and knowledgeable about natural food supplements. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more natural and organic vitamins and coffee for her customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.   

Rosario hopes for her direct selling business to flourish. She dreams of having another business like a canteen for additional income. She wants to buy a vehicle for the church service. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her natural and herbal vitamins and products to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, a sari-sari store owner from Iloilo, Philippines is a hard working and optimistic woman. At the age of 55, Evangeline still operates her small grocery store to cater the needs of her customers and her buyers. She has three grown up children. 

As of now, Evangeline plans to expand her store so that it will generate more income. For this, she has made a loan request from CEVI to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, soda and beverages. A loan will allow Evangeline to augment her inventories in her store. 

Evangeline is hopeful that her business will become more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, soda and beverages

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Raisa is the coordinator of her group, Fe y Esperanza ("Faith and Hope"). Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a new and still undeveloped tourism industry. She has two children, and she is a single mom. 

Raisa wants to reinvest in her business where she sells new clothing to increase her business inventory. Having repaid her previous loans, and because her business has grown, Raisa is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, T-shirts, underwear and others types of clothes. 

She will use her business profits to save and reinvest in her business and to supply some of the needs of her family. 

Raisa dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman. This Esperanza associate began with Esperanza to access loans for her business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita spends considerable time preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay in Mahayag. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

Lenita has presented her request to Paglaum MPC for a loan.  She hopes to double her yield so that she can send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: From Dumingag, Ruth and her husband farm rice to earn a living. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland in the hope of a larger harvest. Ruth wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their wetland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, rice flour, chicharrón, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Meldrin

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Ma. Meldrin works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making and selling mats.  Ma. Meldrin is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Ma. Meldrin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and works in a mechanic shop as a receptionist.  She developed a hereditary cornea problem that is affecting her to focus near and far side objects which is really bothering her because she's having frequent headaches and pain in the eyes.  The only option for her is to have surgery but due to the high cost she has not have the
surgery done yet.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Mallieta

texts.en:
Mallieta is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Elmeres

texts.es:
Elmeres tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, dedicados al cultivo de café en el caserio de Vista Alegre en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Elmeres se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace 8 años en el Caserio Vista Alegre. Elmeres desea el crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo, lo que le permitirá incrementar los rendimientos de su cultivo. Elmeres posee conocimientos en el negocio por lo cual se espera que sea una gran cosecha con una utilidad aceptable que le permita mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmeres, age 27, lives with his wife and his young son.  They grow coffee in the Vista Alegre village in the Callayuc district in the Cajamarca province and region in the northern highlands of Peru.  His community works basically in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Elmeres has been growing coffee in the Vista Alegre village for eight years.  Elmeres wants the loan to buy compost and fertilizers for his crop.  This will allow him to increase his crop performance.

Elmeres is knowledgeable about the business, and he hopes that it will be a big harvest with an acceptable profit.  This will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings, and, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small-time borrower like her. 

Perla has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, soy sauce, eggs, and soft drinks to increase stock. 

Perla wishes to live a comfortable life and have an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, soy sauce, eggs, and soft drinks to increase stock and earn more income.

loans.name: Benilde Normaliza

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Benilde, una señora de 59 años, quien convive con el señor Aquiles ya varios años. 
Benilde siempre le ha ayudado a su esposo a salir adelante pesar, ha trabajado mucho para poder construir su humilde hogar. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda la misma que atiende todos los días, mientras su esposo realiza fletes en el mercado de mariscos en su camioneta.
Son una pareja muy unida, se dan apoyo mutuamente. Benilde es una clienta nueva en la institución, acudió a ella por la oportunidad que brindan al ayudar al microempresario a través de créditos. Se siente feliz ya que con el crédito recibido ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos ya que va a comprar más mercadería para surtir el negocio y además le ayudará a su esposo a un mantenimiento que necesita la camioneta.
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados ia a city in the coastal region known in the country for being a very productive and commercial area.  At this point there exists a lot of commercial interchange because it is the gateway that unites the highlands and the coast.  Benilde, age 59, lives here.  She has lived with Aquiles for several years.

Benilde has always helped her husband get ahead.  She has worked a lot in order to be able to build her humble home.  She has a small store that she tends every day.  Meanwhile, her husband carries freight in his truck for the seafood market.  They are a very united couple, and they mutually support each other.

Benilde is a new client with the institution.  She turned to the institution for the opportunity that it provides to help small business people through loans.  She is happy with the loan she received.  She will be able to improve her income because she will buy more merchandise to stock the business.  It will also help her husband with maintenance that the truck needs.

She is grateful to those with the Fundación Alternativa and especially Kiva.  With the loans that they give they help a lot of people who need to prosper in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is involved in a farming and hog-raising business. He has been raising his hogs and crops for eight years. 

Regie would like to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stock feed and vitamins for his hogs and fertilizer for his farming business. He hopes that through this loan, he could further improve the growth of his hogs upon reaching their maturity period. 

Regie is looking forward to approval of his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase stock feed and vitamins for his hogs and fertilizer for his farming business

loans.name: Bernadshan

texts.en: Bernadshan is a married man with the responsibility of looking after five children. He earns a salary from teaching in a primary school. Bernadshan desires to educate his children to University although he faces a challenge of delayed payment of his salary. He needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Biady

texts.en: Biady is a very hardworking person who has always worked and strived to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a food cafe. which she's had for more than three years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that, she has a good clientele. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Biady is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil and other products to stock her business and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga is married. She is known in their neighborhood area for being a persevering mother. Santiaga is receiving a monthly pension from her retirement in her previous job as a local public employee. 

She became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which reason she applied for a loan of PHP40,000 to purchase construction materials for her house for a larger, comfortable living space for the family. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house for a larger, comfortable living space for the family

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives together with her husband and children at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for some time now, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Dolores de 41 años de edad  y es residente en Sololá.

La actividad que  realiza es la siembra de arveja  y maíz, el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de ello y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arvejas. Una de las metas de Dolores es incrementar su producto de maíz y arvejas  mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de ello para tener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by hands that like to work and take care of it.  It is a trade that men work at for years and for their entire lives, and it is worthy of admiration.  Without the work of dedicated men in the fields, the land would not produce the products that generally sustain every generation.  It is that work that Dolores, age 41, does.  He is a resident of Sololá.

He grows peas and corn.  He chose this business activity because he has land, the climate is suitable for these crops, and it generates good income for him.  His second business activity is working as a day worker in his community.  He always intends to help his neighbors in the community.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his corn and bean crops.  One of Dolores’s goals is to increase his corn and pea production.  He wants to improve the way he manages the crops in order to have better income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air compressor

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia, 58, is very responsible with her household obligations as she has always helped her husband to provide the best for their family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants rice.  Soon it will be harvest time.

Clemencia wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to hire laborers to help with harvesting and cultivating the land.  This will increase sales, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help with harvest.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
In 2012,  Nicasia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it offers.  Nicasia tried her luck in doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.  

Nicasia borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost for more harvest and sales. This will help give her farming income a big boost.  Nicasia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, 45 years old, lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She was gifted with three children. 

Perla is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious coop member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural produce.
 
In need of additional working capital, Perla decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 25,000 to buy farm inputs and fertilizers and pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Perla is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a jeepney someday to use for transportation service.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Luceno

texts.en:
Luceno is 58 years old. He is married with 11 children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Luceno and his wife earn a living through rice farming. They are also engaged in different farming activities in order for his big family to survive. They mastered doing these types of activities when they got married in order to support their needs. He joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in May 2012. He is a hardworking father who has a strong determination to pursue his goals for the benefit of his family, alleviating their poverty.

Luceno requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm and pay for seedlings and compost for his cabbage production. This will help give his farming income a big boost. Someday, he hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand his rice production and venture into a rice retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on his rice farm and pay for seedlings and compost for his cabbage production.

loans.name: Lupercio

texts.en:
Lupercio is married with three children. He is 60 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. Lupercio is a farmer and grows palay (paddy rice) and vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 25 years. He has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and chemicals. 

Lupercio has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lupercio hopes to harvest more palay (rice) and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 35 years old, married and has two children. One of her children is in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aiza has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
In 2006, Benedicta began digging through trash to collect used drinking straws, which she used to make bags, mats and jewelry. Despite the shame she faced for spending her days picking up and working with trash, she perservered and the lovely handcrafted items became a successful business, earning her praise and recognition. Benedicta used her leadership to create the Kinawataka Women Initiatives co-operative with a mission to help marginalized women develop entrepreneurial, artisan and agricultural skills so they may create a sustainable income for themselves and their families. The co-operative also supports the needs of many orphans in the area.

Kinawataka Women Initiatives is seeking additional capital to fully utilize the 10 acres of land it has available for farming. This loan will help the women purchase seedlings, livestock, raw artisan materials and a small truck to help them transport goods efficiently to market so they can maximize their earning potential.

Benedicta is a participant in The Coca-Cola Company's 5by20 program. For more information about her story and the Kinawataka Women Initiatives co-operative, visit www.5by20.com.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and raw materials to expand agricultural and artisan business; and to purchase a vehicle to more efficiently transport goods to the market.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita operates a motor transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. For her to continue her business, she accessed a loan to purchase a side car for her motorcycle business . She dreams of owning other motor units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a side car for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Raushan

texts.ru: Раушан 35 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Раушан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду Раушан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,0 ГА, на котором Раушан ежегодно выращивает картофель под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Экологически чистую продукцию, а также домашнее молоко Раушан реализует местным жителям и оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный доход Раушан свыше 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 нетели  для разведения. Раушан планирует направлять доход от кредита в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также вкладывать в воспитание и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Raushan is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children, some of whom are in school while the others are still in preschool.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business in 1999.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows and ten sheep, and she also grows potatoes, annually, on a 4- hectare plot of land.  The potatoes that she grows are used both for the family's own consumption and for resale.  She sells her organic crops and home-made milk to the local residents as well as to wholesale buyers.  Raushan makes more than 20,000 som per month (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy one heifer for breeding.  Raushan is planning to reinvest her earnings from her loan into further increasing her business and into her children's education and upbringing.

loans.use: to purchase one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.
